name: Ho Dynasty Citadel
description:
Ho Dynasty Citadel, located in district Vinh Loc, province Thanh Hoa, is a massive and unique stone structure, built in 1397 under the reign Ho Dynasty. Not only is it a historical relic, Ho Dynasty Citadel is also a cultural icon, a demonstration of the remarkable creativity and construction techniques of the ancient Vietnamese. The relic was designated as a World Cultural Heritage by UNESCO in 2011.

Ho Dynasty Citadel is located in a highly geographical location. To the north and west are the Buoi River, to the east are the Ma Tuong River, creating a strong natural defense system. Surrounding the city are magnificent limestone mountains, which both enhance the natural beauty and form strong walls. This position shows the strategic vision of Ho Quy Ly in selecting the site for the construction of the capital, ensuring both safety and conducive to trade and economic development.

To better understand Lake City, we need to learn about its historical background. By the end of the 14th century, Tran Dynasty had weakened, the country was in a state of crisis. Ho Quy Ly, an ambitious reformer, came to power and established the Ho Dynasty in 1400. To consolidate power and implement its reforms, Ho Quy Ly decided to move the capital from Thang Long (Hanoi today) to Tay Do (Vinh Loc, Thanh Hoa) and build House Ho City.
location: District Vinh Loc, province Thanh Hoa

additionalInfo.architectural: The relic area includes Thanh Noi (stone wall), La Thanh (landing) and Nam Giao sacrifices and many adjacent relics. The estimated amount of building stones is about 20,000 m³, the ground is about 80,000-100,000 m³; there are large stones weighing over 20 tons.

historicalEvents.title: Build Event Ho Dynasty Citadel
historicalEvents.description: In early 1397, under the intense direction of Ho Quy Ly — an eminent figure in the late Tran dynasty, the construction of Ho Dynasty Citadel was officially started in An Ton land, now in Vinh Loc district, Thanh Hoa province. The construction of the castle took place for a very short period of time, only three months, from January to March. The castle was designed with the goal of becoming a new capital, both strategically sound and showing the strong central power of the new dynasty. The work uses large blocks of stone, weighing from 10 to 20 tons, elaborately crafted and completely hand-assembled with mortar-free stone grafting techniques, demonstrating the technical level and high-level labor organization of the time. The construction of Ho Dynasty Citadel is not only the beginning of a new capital, but also the hallmark of the country's desire to reform and protect it in a turbulent time.

historicalEvents.title: Ho Quy Ly ascend the throne and establish a dynasty Ho Dynasty
historicalEvents.description: In 1400, after a period of holding power in the imperial court Tran Dynasty, Ho Quy Ly officially deposed King Tran Thuan Tong and ascended the throne himself, founding the dynasty Ho Dynasty. Along with changing the dynasty, he changed his national name from Dai Viet to Dai Ngu, meaning "a prosperous peace and prosperity". Ho Dynasty Citadel, built just a few years earlier, immediately became the official capital, where the government placed its apparatus and conducted key national activities. The relocation of the capital from Thang Long to the West is not only an expression of Ho Quy Ly's ambition to consolidate power, but also an important geopolitical strategy to avoid the threat from the North, while also providing comprehensive reform opportunities from politics, economy to society. This event marked a major turning point in the history of Vietnam at the beginning of the XV century.

historicalEvents.title: Ho Dynasty Citadel fall to the Ming army
historicalEvents.description: After efforts to reform and defend, by 1407, the dynasty Ho Dynasty quickly fell into a state of defeat in the face of massive invasion by the Ming army from the North. Under the pressure of a powerful army and stormy attack tactics, Ho Dynasty Citadel —, though strong and majestic, — could not hold. After fierce battles, the castle fell, leading to the fall of the dynasty Ho Dynasty. Ho Quy Ly and his royal family members were taken alive and taken back to China. Though the stronghold was partly destroyed during the war, the massive stone walls and strong gate systems survived to this day, becoming a historical witness to a turbulent period and great lessons about the nation's fate.

historicalEvents.title: Ho Dynasty Citadel be recognized by UNESCO World Cultural Heritage
historicalEvents.description: On June 27, 2011, at the 35th meeting of the World Heritage Committee under UNESCO held in Paris (France), Ho Dynasty Citadel were honored to be officially listed as World Cultural Heritage. This is a historic turning point, noting the global outstanding values of this unique stone architecture. UNESCO appreciate Ho Dynasty Citadel based on two important criteria: cultural intersections between civilizations and typical patterns of Eastern power architecture. This recognition not only enhances the status of relics on the world cultural map, but also opens up great opportunities in preserving and promoting heritage values, while also promoting tourism and developing the local cultural economy

name: Central Thang Long Imperial Citadel - Hanoi
description: The central area Thang Long Imperial Citadel in Hanoi is an archaeological and historical relic associated with the capital Thang Long through many dynasties (Ly, Tran, Le, Nguyen). The central area recognized by UNESCO as a World Cultural Heritage (2010), consists of archaeological sites 18 Hoang Dieu and relics such as Doan Mon Gate, Kinh Thien Palace, Flagpole.
location: District Ba Dinh, city Hanoi

additionalInfo.architectural: Heritage core range ~18-20 hectares, including archaeological site 18 Hoang Dieu and the remaining ancient citadel relics. Excavations have discovered many layers of culture, palace, pillars, and artifacts from the Ly ‑ Tran onwards.

historicalEvents.title: Precedence stage Thang Long
historicalEvents.description: During the period of Nha Tang, An Nam was divided into 12 continents with 50 districts, Tung Binh was the center of An Nam's capital, which was the first land that later became Thang Long to hold the role of a center of political power. In 866, the Tang general, Cao Bien, built a new city, Tung Binh was renamed Dai - the capital of the Quanh navy.According to legend, Cao Bien saw a god who appeared to call himself the god Long Do. Therefore, history also called Thang Long Long Do land. At the end of the 9th century, the Tang central government severely weakened. In the early 8th century, sand forces kept beating each other to kill each other, creating chaos to divide the Five Ten Kingdoms, for example.Zhou Yu, who was supported by the people, went to the capital city of Dala, claiming to be a secret envoy. After gaining practical power on the land of Tinh Navy, he built a government based on the name of the capital government supporting the Tang Dynasty, but was actually an independent and administered by the Vietnamese. In 931,Duong Dinh Nghe brought troops from Ai Chau to Dai La to chase away the history of Ly Tien of Nam Han country. Ly Tien fled, Duong Dinh Nghe liberated Dai La for 6 years and was killed by Kieu Cong Chieu in 938, Ngo Quyen Dai La, Kieu Cong Chieu was defeated, Han army.In the spring of 939, he called himself Ngo Vuong, not stationed in Dala but in Co Loa. After Dinh Tien Hoang the rebellion of 12 emissaries, the Dinh Dynasties, Tien Le were stationed in Hoa Lu.Dai La is now under the supervision of Professor Liu Co and renovates the Imperial City to the south (towards the capital Hoa Lu instead of the north as the capital city government did) so this official is considered the person who "gives the key" to Dai La to Ly Thai To.

historicalEvents.title: The Ly - Tran period from the 11th century to the 14th century
historicalEvents.description: In 1010, the king Ly Thai To the imperial decree moved the capital from Hoa Lu to Dai La, renamed it Thang Long. The city was built in a model of the Three Kingdoms including La Thanh surrounding the people, the Imperial City setting the imperial court and the Forbidden City as the king's residence. The city has four gates of Tuong Phu, Quang Phuc, Dai Hung and Dieu Duc. Major palaces such as Can Nguyen, Long An, Long Thuy, Nhat Quang, Nguyet Minh, Thuy Hoa. In 1029, Ly Thai Tong rebuilt the Forbidden City with Tianan Palace, Dragon Yard, Tuyen Duc Palace, Thien Phuc Palace, Phung Tien Palace, Thien Khanh Palace, Truong Xuan Palace. In 1203, Ly Cao Tong continued to expand with Kinh Thien, Duong Minh, Chinh Nghi, Thang Tho, Nhat Kim, Nguyet Bao and many lakes and gardens such as Quynh Lam, Thuong Lam, Phuong Lien. The plan still follows the old background, the main gate is Chinh Duong Mon with Nhat Tan and Van Hoi auxiliary gates. The palace is still Tiananmen Palace, the king in Guan Trieu Palace, the emperor in Sanctuary Palace, the crown prince in Shaolin, the court lady in Le Thien or Thuong Xuan. In the middle of the 14th century, Lac Thanh Tri's garden was built with lakes, rocky mountains, precious trees, exotic animals, and corridors connecting the palaces. The architecture of the Tran dynasty was large and highly technical, indicating the development of the capital Thang Long.

historicalEvents.title: The Le - Mac period from the 15th century to the 18th century
historicalEvents.description: After defeating the Ming army, Le Thai To still stationed the capital in Thang Long but renamed it Dong Kinh. Basically, Dong Kinh during the Le Dynasty was not much different from Thang Long generations of Ly, Tran, Ho, Le Thai To to renovate the citadel due to the war against the Ming troops. The palace was rectangular, the wall was built with bricks over 5 m high.The main gate is located in the south. The two armpit doors are Dong Trang An and Tay Trang An. In 1428, Le Thai To rebuilt a series of palaces as a place of tides where the king works and the palace's residence. The axis that goes from Doan Mon Gate in is Chuoc, Thi Trieu, Electricity, Can Chanh and Hau.Ngoc Ha electricity transmission was built on the background of the previous area, which was a branch of the Red River. Later on, people filled that branch, the water gathered into a lake located right in front of the electricity, and to enter the electricity, it had to be called Ngoc Ha electricity. In addition, Van Tho electricity,The emperor's residence Le Dynasty for 100 years. East of this palace is Donggung Palace, the residence of the Crown Prince. Le Thai To also built large palaces such as the English Association, Khoi Duc, Tuyen Vo, Thuy Ngoc, Thua Hoa, Kim Loan, Bao Quang, etc. From 1490 to the new century until the 16th century.During this time, the walls of the palace as well as the Great Wall were always expanded. In 1490, in preparation for party riots such as Le Nghi Dan was climbing the wall at night to kill Le Nhan Tong in the palace, Le Thanh Tong for the reconstruction of the Imperial City. Construction work was completed in 8 months.King Le Thanh Tong also built additional palaces and established Shangri-La gardens to raise animals. Le Hien Tong, the 5th king of the Le Pre Dynasty, ruled from 1497 to 1504 and built more magnificent palaces: Shenyang, Jianxing, Zhuang Sinh, or Liu Bei with a system to lead water from far back to 1512.Le Tuong Fei assigned Vu Nhu To to take charge of the construction of more than 100 magnificent palace roofs, starting with the construction of Cuu Chong Tai, as described by the old history, although the shade of the West Lake was not completed. In 1514, Le Tuong Fei expanded the Hoang Thanh (e each is 3m60) covering the palace, Vu Tran and Kim Hoa Temple.Between 1516 and 1527 were the year the Mac dynasty robbed the Le Dynasty, the capital of Tokyo was in chaos. Most of the temple treasure palaces and the street were destroyed many times. In the second half of the 16th century, inter-Korean affairs with one side being Mac and one side being Le-Trinh took place fiercely with an increasingly southern side.Trinh took many northern provinces in turn such as Ninh Binh, Ha Nam, Bac Ninh... and fought until Thang Long. The Mac family had to leave the city and flee from one place. Tokyo was becoming dilapidated. By 1585, Mac Mau Hop could not stand such a life in exile, and decided to return to Tokyo. A large-scale construction was started.In 1599, Trinh Tung chased the Mac family up Cao Bang to take over Thang Long. Hoang Thanh was repaired in a month to welcome King Lera. From then on, the newly built palaces were all located in the Trinh Palace. During the Le Trung Hung era, with the presence of the Kinh Thien in Trinh Palace,Kinh Thien Palace was used as a place of worship for heaven and earth and performed important ceremonies such as coronation and ordination, holy life, official ceremony... Le kings during the Le Trung Hung period mainly worked at Can Chanh Palace.

historicalEvents.title: The period from city Thang Long to province Hanoi
historicalEvents.description: In 1788, Le Chieu Thong asked for the Qing Dynasty's assistance, Ton Thanh Nghi brought his army of 29,000 men to occupy Thang Long without spending an arrow bullet. At the beginning of 1789, Quang Trung Nguyen Hue to the North for the third time to crush the Qing army, Le Chieu Thong fled to China, the end of the Hau Le Dynasty, Quang Trung set in Phu Xuan. Thang Long is just the North.In 1802 after the destruction of Tay Son, Nguyen Anh ascended to the throne. The capital city is still located in Phu Xuan. Thang Long is still called Thang Long but the word "Long" is a dragon that has been changed to "Long" meaning prosperity means that the king is no longer there.At the same time, what remains of the Imperial City after the great battles of the late 18th century was transferred to Phu Xuan by kings Nguyen Dynasty for the construction of the new city. Only Kinh Thien and Hau Lau Palace were kept as archers for Nguyen kings every time the Northern Jade. In 1805,Gia Long demolish the walls of the old Imperial City because it is assumed to be only Bac City, so it must not be larger than Hue, but Hoang Thanh Thang Long is too large. Gia Long for the construction of a new French Vauban. In terms of scale is much smaller than the old city. In 1831,during the major administrative reform Minh Mang renamed Thang Long province Hanoi. This name existed until 1888 when Nguyen Dynasty officially ceded Hanoi to France. The French changed Hanoi city. Until they took over Indochina, they chose this as the capital of the French Indochina Federation.The Hanoi city was completely destroyed to make land work and barracks for the French. Except for the North Gate and the flagpole, what remains of Hanoi to this day is just archaeological and restoration relics.

historicalEvents.title: The period of awakening to Hanoi in Nguyen Dynasty
historicalEvents.description: The Hanoi built by Gia Long also follows the form of other provinces and the main thing is not to be larger than Phu Xuan. In 1804, the old citadel was demolished and the following year a smaller (5 km) wall was built in the Vauban style of France. The surrounding city was square about a kilometer deep moat.The four walls corresponding to the four current streets are: Phan Dinh Phung Street in the North, Ly Nam De Street in the East, Tran Phu Street in the South, Hung Vuong Street in the West. The walls are made of boxes made of green ice and bees stones. The walls are 1 meter high, on the 4th. The Thanh opened 5th is the East gate (the Dong gate).West gate (corresponding to Bac Son street now), North gate (now still), Southwest gate (corresponding to Chu Van An and Nguyen Thai Hoc streets now), Dong Nam gate (corresponding to Dien Bien Phu and Nguyen Thai Hoc now). The entrance to the archway through the long wall is called 23 m. Each gate is called a zoo.Around the wall is a 6-7m wide strip of land, then a trench 15-16m wide, 5m deep that connects the To Lich and Red rivers. Hao is always there but usually only about 1m high. Outside the gates, there is a row of walls built on the trench called Duong Horse, 2 9m long and 7m high.All of the city's cities are trying one side door called Nhan Mon. From the outside, they have to go through Nhan Mon before going to the gate. The inner side of the city is arranged as follows: In the center of the city is Kinh Thien Palace built from the Le Dynasty on Nung Mountain. The electricity is built on huge wooden pillars hugging people. The temple also has two beautiful dragons from the Le Dynasty.This electricity was destroyed by the French and built on the old platform of the Dragon building to serve as the French artillery headquarters. After 1954, the dragon's house became the headquarters of the People's Army General Staff Vietnam. This was also the venue for a meeting of extended Politburo on March 21, 1975 determined to liberate South Korea in two years 75-76.To the east of the city is the headquarters of the Northern Town of Nguyen Van Thanh at the beginning of Nguyen Dynasty. To the west is the barn, and his father's house is the officer in charge of those warehouses. In 1812 he set up a Flagpole Hanoi south of town. In 1835, considering that it was Hanoi higher than Minh Mang, Hue and cut by 18 inches.Castle Hanoi is only about 5 meters high. In 1848, the king Tu Duc demolished the remaining Hau Le dynasty palaces in the city, art sculptures made of wood and stone all returned Hue to decorate the palaces in it, leaving only stone dragons in Kinh Thien Palace...

name: Tran Temple and Chua Pho Minh
description: The relic clusters of Temple Tran and Temple Pho Minh (Nam Dinh) are the representative religious, religious and cultural centers of the Tran dynasty. Tran Temple is a place where traditional festivals are held with the history of resistance against foreign invaders and kings of Tran and generals. The pagoda Pho Minh has a distinctive pagoda, reflecting the flourishing Buddhist architectural art of the Tran Dynasty; along with auxiliary works, the population has an archaeological-art value. In 2012, this relic was rated as a National Special relic, confirming the historical importance and architectural-art value. Currently, the relic sites are managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and are an important destination for scientific research and cultural tourism.
location: City Nam Dinh, province Nam Dinh

additionalInfo.culturalFestival: The Tran Temple Festival is held every year from August 15 to 20 of the lunar calendar in Loc Vuong ward, Nam Dinh city, Nam Dinh province to pay tribute to 14 Tran kings. Since 2000, Nam Dinh held the Tran Temple Opening Ceremony at dawn on January 15. Initially, the opening ceremony was limited to the space of Mu village,gradually becoming the grand festival. "Style of the Prehistoric Temple" is the seal used to seal the present Chenle Temple Festival. Square, wooden seal, made in Nguyen Dynasty, late 19th century, early 20th century. The East-West sides of the two dragon-shaped seal, the South side of the four-shaped indented border of the "Facility." The "Style" "Style" "Style" is a classic self-shaped ceiling" carries a typical content.the custom of worshipping at the shrine Tran Dynasty.

historicalEvents.title: The Rebuilding of Temple of Tran
historicalEvents.description: In 1665, amid the country's temporary peace under Hau Le, the people Nam Dinh under the leadership of local officials and the support of the royal court organized the reconstruction of the Temple of Tran on the destroyed old Thai temple. The temple construction was to commemorate the merits of the kings of Tran, who led the nation Vietnam through the "three-time defeat of Nguyen Mong" era, accomplishing an immortal miracle in world history. The restoration of the Temple of Tran has not only a deep spiritual meaning, but also affirms the national pride, continuous continuity of the cultural traditions Vietnam throughout historical periods.

historicalEvents.title: The Festival of the Revelation of the Temple of Tran - a sacred tradition
historicalEvents.description: The Temple Tran Open Festival, which has been associated with tradition since Tran Dynasty, is held on the night of the 14th and 15th of the first lunar month every year, wishing for a prosperous, prosperous, and prosperous New Year. According to legend, at the beginning of the year, the imperial court Tran Dynasty often hold a "openness" ceremony to start the implementation of the state affairs in the new year. However, due to many historical events, this ritual used to be interrupted for a long time. By 2000, the Enlightenment festival was officially restored, becoming a large spiritual cultural event attracting tens of thousands of tourists from all over the world to participate, creating a solemn and sacred atmosphere, but no less exciting and bustling.

historicalEvents.title: Pagoda Pho Minh and Tower Pho Minh - Traces of Tran dynasty architecture
historicalEvents.description: The pagoda Pho Minh was built in the late 13th century, early 14th century, under the rule of the king Tran Nhan Tong, associated with the brilliant development of Buddhism in the Tran dynasty. With an initial scale of extremely grandeur, the pagoda used to be considered the great Buddhist center of the city of Thien Truong. In particular, the Pho Minh tower - built with skilled techniques, well-heated, completely arranged bricks without adhesives - has remained standing for more than 700 years. The existence of the Pho Minh tower is a vivid demonstration of the flourishing development of Dai Viet Buddhist architecture art and the deep religious devotion of the dynasty Tran Dynasty.

historicalEvents.title: Discovered traces of Thai temple foundation architecture
historicalEvents.description: During archaeological excavations that took place from 2000 to 2002 at Tran Temple and Pho Minh Pagoda areas, archaeologists Vietnam discovered many important traces that prove the foundation of the ancient Thai temple still exists under the current soil. Artifacts such as decorative bricks, stone base engraved with Tran dynasty patterns, jade pottery pieces, and some ancient foundation structures have shown the true existence of the royal Thai temple Tran Dynasty - a monumental and large structure that was destroyed by the Ming army in the 15th century. This discovery further increased the historical and cultural value of the Temple of Tran - Pagoda Pho Minh population in the hearts of people all over the country.

name: Pay Phu Dong
description: The temple Phu Dong (Giong Temple) in commune Phu Dong, district Gia Lam (Hanoi) is the center of the shrine Thanh Giong, a heroic symbol in the legend Vietnam. The temple and the system of auxiliary works represent the belief of national hero worship; the Giong festival has intangible cultural value, reflecting traditional rituals, performances and community activities. Currently, the relic sites are managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and are an important destination for scientific research and cultural tourism.
location: District Gia Lam, city Hanoi

additionalInfo.architectural: The remaining architecture of Giong Temple consists of many works on a large area. The Triangle of the temple is quite large, with attic, two small doors on both sides. On the steps are two stone dragons, carved in 1705. In front of the gate is a large yard, facing a waterway in the middle of a lake, next to a multi-purpose root. The Thuong is the place of folk games and water puppet show.A couple of sentences written in front of the temple gate: Behind the main gate is an eight-roofed pavilion, two stone lions at the foot of the foot, followed by the wide roadway where ceremonies are held. The incense altar is decorated with incense sticks, followed by the harem. In the harem, there are statues Thanh Giong and guardian generals, which are also the feudal dynasties.In the harem, a pair of porcelain dogs are also kept as artifacts, only used during the festival. The harem's steps also hold dragon-touch bricks, believed to have existed since the Ly dynasty. In the temple, there is also a stone monument built in 1660. Behind the temple is a clear well called Ngoc well. From the entrance, to the right of the main temple, there are also houses, for festival participants.divided the sacrifices of the surrounding communes. On the left side of the temple is Kien Sister Pagoda.
additionalInfo.culturalFestival: The main festival of the temple is the Giong festival. The festival takes place from April 7 to 9 in the lunar calendar every year (the main festival is April 9). The Giong festival is held on a larger scale (5 years, in the years ending 0 or 5) called the main festival, the remaining years are called a convention.

historicalEvents.title: Originating the legend Thanh Giong and forming the Temple Phu Dong
historicalEvents.description: According to folklore, right after Thanh Giong's victory over the An, the villagers Phu Dong set up a shrine to show their gratitude and honor the immortal hero. The kings of the later dynasties all sharpened, repaired and worshipped the temple to remember this great feat. This is considered an event that laid the foundation for the creation of the Temple relic population Phu Dong, confirming the sacred position of this place in the Vietnamese mind

historicalEvents.title: Major restoration of the Temple Phu Dong (Dynasties Ly, Tran, Le, Nguyen)
historicalEvents.description: Throughout history, the Temple Phu Dong has been repeatedly renovated, expanded, and cultivated by feudal dynasties Vietnam. Especially under Ly - Tran - Le, the temple was renovated on a large scale, becoming one of the most important religious centers in the North. The dynasty Nguyen Dynasty also repeatedly ordained, repaired architectural works, embellished the temple with dignity and prestige, reflecting the enduring tradition of worshiping Thanh Giong in the hearts of the nation.

historicalEvents.title: Giong Festival at Temple Phu Dong
historicalEvents.description: The Giong Festival at Temple Phu Dong, held annually in April of the lunar calendar, is a major cultural and religious event to recreate Thanh Giong's achievements in fighting enemies and rescuing the country. The main ceremonies include a procession of palanquin, sacrificial rites, and the reenactment of fake battles, with the large participation of local people as soldiers and soldiers. In 2010, the Giong festival was officially designated as a representative intangible cultural heritage of humanity by UNESCO, marking a turning point in enhancing the international status for a distinctive cultural feature of Vietnam

historicalEvents.title: The Great Rehabilitation Event of the Temple Phu Dong
historicalEvents.description: In the late 20th century and early 20th century, before the decline due to time and war, local governments and people carried out major restoration work at the Temple Phu Dong. Major items such as the Supreme Temple, the Model Temple, the Tam Quan Gate, the temple yard, the shrine... remodeled and renovated based on the principle of preserving the original state of traditional architecture, both ensuring preservation of historical value, and facilitating the reception of visitors and beliefs.

historicalEvents.title: 1000th Anniversary Activities Thang Long - Hanoi at Temple Phu Dong
historicalEvents.description: In 2010, on the occasion of the 1000th anniversary of Thang Long - Hanoi, the Temple Phu Dong was honored to be one of the important highlights of this important series of events. Giong's ritual and festival activities are held on an unprecedented scale, contributing to the broad introduction of traditional cultural beauty Phu Dong to a large number of international friends and people around the country, confirming the irreplaceable role of this relic in the flow of the thousand-year-old history of the capital.

name: Hoan Kiem Lake and Ngoc Son Temple
description: Hoan Kiem Lake (Sword Lake) located in the center of Hanoi, has a prominent historical and cultural position associated with the legend Le Loi return of the sword. The area around the lake is densely populated with relics such as Ngoc Son Temple on Ngoc Island, Turtle Tower, and The Huc bridge; this is the important landscape, religion and living space of the Capital. The entire cluster Hoan Kiem Lake - Ngoc Son Temple is rated a National Special relic, as well as a tourist attraction, historical research and urban culture. Currently, the relic sites are managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and are an important destination for scientific research and cultural tourism.
location: District Hoan Kiem, city Hanoi

historicalEvents.title: Legend has it that Le Loi return the Turtle Sword.
historicalEvents.description: One of the most important and sacred events associated with Hoan Kiem Lake is the legend that the king Le Loi returned the Magic Sword to the Turtle right on the lake. After leading the successful Lam Son uprising, kicking out the Minh army, restoring the independence of Dai Viet, the king Le Loi ascended the throne and took the title Le Thai To. According to folklore, during a walk by the king on the clear water of the lake, suddenly a giant golden turtle floated in front of the boat. The golden turtle raised its head to ask the king to return the sword that the Dragon King gave him during the battle. Knowing that fate is fulfilled, the Le Loi honorably present their swords. The golden turtle took the sword and slowly dived to the bottom of the lake, leaving the waves rolling in the bright yellow sun. Since then, the lake has been named "Hoan Kiem" (return of sword) to mark this miraculous event. The legend not only reflects the indomitable spirit of patriotism, but also shows the people's deep faith in the protection of supernatural powers in the nation's Vietnam's patriotic journey.

historicalEvents.title: Build Turtle Tower - Indestructible symbol in the heart of Sword Lake (end of the 19th century)
historicalEvents.description: At the end of the 19th century, in the context of the country's urbanization movement under the French colonial era, a small but very meaningful building was built on a floating mound in the middle of Hoan Kiem Lake - the Turtle Tower. The tower was built with a traditional Asian and Western Gothic architecture, expressed through layered curved roofs, small arch doors, and harmoniously symmetrical shapes. Though not large in scale, Turtle Tower bears deep spiritual significance: a lasting symbol of patriotism, aspiration for peace and national pride. Over the centuries, amid historical upheavals, Turtle Tower stood there, gazing silently into the lake's water, becoming an image closely attached to the memory and soul of generations of people Hanoi and tourists near by.

historicalEvents.title: Remodeling Ngoc Son Temple and Bridge Construction The Huc - Spiritual beauty in the middle of the old town (mid-19th century)
historicalEvents.description: In the mid-19th century, cultural celebrity Nguyen Van Su - a talented intellectual of the Nguyen era - donated and organized the renovation of Ngoc Son Temple, and built the The Huc bridge connecting the lake to Ngoc Island. Ngoc Son Temple Van Xuong De Quan (the god of examination) and Tran Hung Dao - the national hero who defeated the Nguyen Mong army. The Huc Bridge, with its characteristic red color and graceful curves like a strip of peach silk across the blue water, symbolizing the bright light of the morning sun. This work not only enhances the poetic beauty of Hoan Kiem Lake but also strengthens the lake area's role as a center of faith, education and culture in the heart of Hanoi. Nowadays, the image of people leisurely crossing the bridge The Huc to enter Ngoc Son Temple has become a symbol of the elegant and quiet beauty of ancient urban life.

historicalEvents.title: The discovery, care, and death of the old turtle Sword Lake (20th century - XXI)
historicalEvents.description: Another unique highlight in the history of Hoan Kiem Lake is the presence of a rare turtle - believed to be a turtle Hoan Kiem (Rafetus Swinhei) - who has lived in the lake for decades. The turtle Sword Lake is not only a biologically valuable creature, but also has deep symbolic value, associated with the king's legend of sword return Le Loi. In the early years of the 15th century, when the old turtle had health problems, many rescue and care programs were launched in an effort to protect this "living animal". However, in January 2016, the old turtle passed away, leaving deep sorrow in the hearts of people Vietnam. The death of the turtle is not only the loss of the ecosystem but also a special landmark, bringing up historical ups and downs and stimulating the sense of preservation of culture and nature in modern society.

historicalEvents.title: Hoan Kiem Lake - Center for the Organization of Major Hanoi Festivals and Events (XIX century)
historicalEvents.description: In modern times, Hoan Kiem Lake is not only a historical heritage but also a center for many major national and international events. The most representative is the 1,000th anniversary of Thang Long - Hanoi in 2010, when hundreds of thousands of people and international tourists flocked to the area around the lake to participate in parades, art performances and street festivals. Hoan Kiem Lake is also frequently the venue for New Year's countdown programs, flower festivals, folk culture festivals, cultural diplomatic events such as Japanese festivals, Korean festivals, international book festivals, etc. The space around the lake, especially the pedestrian street area, has become an exciting cultural rendezvous, where people enjoy, interact, enjoy art, and experience the elegant Hanoi spirit that is full of vitality.

name: The pagoda Vinh Nghiem
description: The pagoda Vinh Nghiem (Bac Giang) is an ancient temple with historical-architectural value, distinguished by its distinctive system of woodblocks, statues, and architecture. The pagoda plays an important role in regional Buddhist life, while preserving valuable artifacts and materials for traditional religious and artistic research. Currently, the relic sites are managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and are an important destination for scientific research and cultural tourism.
location: City Bac Giang, province Bac Giang

additionalInfo.architectural: The pagoda Vinh Nghiem is large in size, tọa lost on land of about 1 hectare, surrounded by dense bamboo embankments. The pagoda was built on an axis, southeastward of 4 blocks: The Heaven Palace, toà the First Team House, gác the bell, the second team house, and some other buildings. The opening was made of the triangular gate, and then went into more than 100 m of Bai (chùa).Since the day of the pagoda's construction, the two sides of the road have been planted to become a Tung Lam place, with a tree nearly 1m in diameter. On the pagoda's yard, there is a large 6-sided stone, built in the 7th year of Hoang Dinh (1606) with the contents of the restoration of that year. The ancient tombstone, opposite of 5 monks including: Phu Lang Trung (Sha Mon),Thong Dieu Duyen, Thanh Quy, Dinh Phuong Saemen, Thanh Hanh and a number of other towers. The first block in the form of "Cong" (工) includes Bai Street, the Thieu Huong House, the upper house with a spacious design of the seven-style train, leaf blade, eight-shaped roof, and the top three-shaped roof of three-shaped roof. The pagoda is decorated with three-shaped letters.The leaves run frilly around. The interior of the incense burner is decorated and carved brilliantly. Of the 3 folds of the pagoda, there are hammock doors, carved with leaves, birds, delicate delicate delicate patterns painted with gold brocade, on top of which are large magnitudes. The second block is also made in the form of merit but lower and smaller.This is the First Nest house worshiping Huong Van Tran Nhan Tong. In the current First Nest court, there is a rear statue located outside, 2 bays away. Three Truc Lam nests are placed in the rear palace, above there is a "Senior Forest". The third block is a two-story steeple, hanging a large bell. The bell structure is combined with a wooden and brick structure.In the middle of the four ends of the seven, there are small bronze bells (wind bells). The fourth block, the nail-shaped structure (丁) is the house of the Second Ancestor of the French Loa Clan. Previously, there were also the blocks of Tu Vu and Huu Vu Vu, each wide range of 18 compartments is where monks for daily life, and living.The pagoda Vinh Nghiem has just been restored, with a magnificent scale, tráng the same tears as before, rebuilding the triangle according to the old foundation built of 7m long brick, rộng 5m of stone pavement into a cloud dragon step.

historicalEvents.title: Establishment and Development of the Temple Vinh Nghiem under the reign Tran Dynasty
historicalEvents.description:
The pagoda Vinh Nghiem was built in the 13th century under the reign of Tran Dynasty, when the Buddha Tran Nhan Tong decided to leave home to practice after winning two victories over the invaders of Mong - Nguyen. It was Tran Nhan Tong, one of Vietnam's prominent historical figures, that founded the Truc Lam Zen sect - the major meditation line of Vietnam. The temple Vinh Nghiem became an important Buddhist training center of this period.

The Buddha Tran Nhan Tong and his disciples, including Phap Loa and Huyen Quang, chose this place as a place to meet, exchange Buddhist ideas and also start the movement to build the Truc Lam sect. During the early years of the dynasty Tran Dynasty, the pagoda attracted many monks from all over the world in terms of monastic studies. The pagoda Vinh Nghiem has gradually become a symbol of the intersection of Buddhism and the political and cultural life of the nation.

The pagoda has been built on a scale, with major categories such as the upper house, the grand hall, the chief temple, and the ancestral altars. These historical relics have been preserved for centuries, not only showing Buddhist architecture but also reflecting the unique cultural values of the Ly - Tran period. Besides, the Pagoda Vinh Nghiem have helped connect Buddhist monks from all over the world in terms of learning, thereby contributing to strengthening the spirit of solidarity and protecting the Fatherland.

historicalEvents.title: Temple woodblock Vinh Nghiem and Buddhist classic conservation
historicalEvents.description:
The original carpentry shop at the Temple Vinh Nghiem is one of the most valuable legacies of Buddhism Vietnam. This woodblock contains thousands of woodblocks with scriptures and Buddhist books carved in wood. They are not only important materials for the propagation of doctrines, but also play an important role in maintaining Buddhist knowledge, educating many generations of monks and believers.

The carving of the woodblock for printing Buddhist scriptures was done very early in the Temple Vinh Nghiem, especially in the years of the 15th - 16th centuries. These woodblocks are made of fine wood, finely carved, showing the meticulous and elaborate work of monks when doing this work. These woodblocks include the scriptures such as the Diamond Bible, the Chinese Scriptures, the Da Bao Tzu, and the teachings of the Forest Service. This helps to preserve valuable knowledge and affirm the status of the Temple Vinh Nghiem in Buddhism Vietnam.

The importance of this mineral deposit lies not only in cultural values, but also in historical values. The woodblocks inscribed the teachings of Buddha, helping Buddhism Vietnam maintain and develop over the centuries. These woodblock prints also spread to many regions, helping Buddhism flourish nationwide.

historicalEvents.title: UNESCO recognition of the Chua Map Vinh Nghiem as a World Documentary Heritage Site (2012)
historicalEvents.description:
In 2012, the pagoda's original mineral deposit Vinh Nghiem was designated as a World Memory Programme documentary of the Asia-Pacific region by UNESCO. This is an important historical event not only for the Temple Vinh Nghiem but also for Buddhism Vietnam, which marks the solid step of the national cultural heritage reaching out to the world.

This event confirms the immense value of the native woodblock in preserving and promoting the Buddhist culture of Vietnam. The original storehouse at the Temple Vinh Nghiem not only helps spread the teachings of Buddhism, but also is also an invaluable intellectual property, helping the world understand more about Buddhist civilization and development in Vietnam.

In addition, UNESCO recognizing the woodwork of the pagoda Vinh Nghiem is also a great pride for the people Vietnam, helping to preserve and promote the traditional cultural values of the nation.

historicalEvents.title: Pagoda Vinh Nghiem recognized Special National Monument (in 2015)
historicalEvents.description:
In 2015, the Pagoda Vinh Nghiem was decided by the Prime Minister Vietnam to be designated as a special national relic. This is a noble title for relics with outstanding historical, cultural and religious value, which has a far-reaching influence on the social and cultural life of the country.

This event is not only a recognition of the long-term historical value of the Temple Vinh Nghiem, but also a foundation for the conservation and promotion of relic value to be carried out more methodically and scientifically. The pagoda Vinh Nghiem, as a special heritage, not only attracting a large number of tourists from all walks of life but also as a destination for domestic and foreign researchers and scholars.

Being recognized as a special National Heritage Site also opens up opportunities for spiritual tourism development in the Bac Giang area, helping people raise awareness about the protection and preservation of cultural values. The government and authorities have also implemented programs to restructure, re-create architectural works, protect valuable woodblocks, and promote the value of relics in cultural and festival activities.

historicalEvents.title: Festival Vinh Nghiem - Spiritual cultural highlights
historicalEvents.description:
The festival Vinh Nghiem is held every year on February 14 of the lunar calendar, which is an occasion for people and tourists from all over the world to participate in a ceremony to pray for peace, commemorating the gratitude of the Buddha Tran Nhan Tong and the Fathers of Architecture. It is a festival with a strong Buddhist cultural identity, bringing together many rituals, spiritual activities, and folk cultural activities such as dragon dance, lion dance, oars singing, and mandarin singing.

The festival is not only an opportunity for people to appreciate their elders, but also an opportunity for the community to gather together and pray for the national peace. This is also an opportunity for Buddhists from all over the world to visit temples, attend monastic courses, learn about Buddhist teachings and practice.

With the development of spiritual tourism, the festival Vinh Nghiem has attracted a large number of domestic and foreign tourists. This festival is also one of the activities to promote the image of the temple Vinh Nghiem and Buddhism Vietnam to the world.

name: Chairman's monument Ton Duc Thang at My Hoa Hung
description: The Chairman's memorial area Ton Duc Thang at My Hoa Hung (An Giang) is the place where artifacts, documents related to life and career of the Chairman Ton Duc Thang are kept. The relic site includes exhibits, memorial spaces, and artifacts for traditional education, memorial and research on revolutionary history. Currently, the relic sites are managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and are an important destination for scientific research and cultural tourism.
location: City Long Xuyen, province An Giang

historicalEvents.title: Date of establishment of the Memorial Park
historicalEvents.description: The Chairman's Memorial Park Ton Duc Thang in My Hoa Hung, in An Giang province, was established in 1980 with the aim of preserving and promoting historical and cultural values associated with the Chairman's life and revolutionary career Ton Duc Thang. This is one of the important historical relics, not only to commemorate his great contributions to the cause of the struggle for national independence, but also to educate the revolutionary traditions for future generations. The monument is home to precious memories of the President Ton Duc Thang, ranging from documents, photos, to items associated with his revolutionary life. The establishment of the Memorial Park is also a way to appreciate the Chairman Ton Duc Thang's silent contributions to the construction and protection of the country, especially during the years of hard and sacrifice war. The monument has become an indispensable destination for those who wish to learn about a heroic part of the history of the nation Vietnam.

historicalEvents.title: The opening ceremony of the Memorial Park
historicalEvents.description: The opening ceremony of the Chairman's Memorial Hall Ton Duc Thang took place on August 20, 1982, marking an important milestone in honoring and commemorating His great achievements. This is not only a historical event for the locality My Hoa Hung but also an opportunity for the entire people Vietnam to look back on the great contributions of the Chairman Ton Duc Thang during the revolutionary life. The opening ceremony was attended by provincial leaders, veterans, representatives of mass organizations and a large number of local people, and many visitors. In a solemn atmosphere, activities to commemorate and praise the Chairman Ton Duc Thang have been held solemnly. In addition to cutting the ribbon of the opening ceremony, the ceremony also features cultural and artistic activities, recreating historical moments in the life of the President Ton Duc Thang, helping citizens and tourists better understand his hard-fought journey from being a patriotic citizen to becoming a great leader of the country. This opening ceremony is not only a prelude to the activities of the Memorial Park, but also an important step in preserving the nation's cultural and historical heritage.

historicalEvents.title: Recognition of the Chairman's contributions Ton Duc Thang
historicalEvents.description: The Chairman's monument Ton Duc Thang is not merely a historical monument, but a place to recognize and appreciate his great contributions to the revolutionary cause of the people Vietnam. Here, souvenirs, documents and photos of the Chairman Ton Duc Thang's life of activities are displayed, allowing citizens and tourists to more clearly imagine a person who has lived and fought for the independence and freedom of the nation. From the early days of participation in the revolution, until becoming President of the country, the President Ton Duc Thang left a deep impression on the people because of their excellent leadership, resilience, extraordinary energy, and passionate patriotism. The monument houses not only images and artifacts, but also a place for the younger generation to better understand the sacrifice mirror, combat resilience, and dedication to the nation's construction work of the President Ton Duc Thang. In addition to honoring his achievements, the Memorial Park has also contributed significantly to educating young generations of history, reminding them of the nation's tradition of heroic struggle, of the noble values that the Chairman Ton Duc Thang have devoted their lives.

historicalEvents.title: Conservation and restoration activities
historicalEvents.description: The Chairman's memorial area Ton Duc Thang has undergone many renovations and upgrades to ensure that historical and cultural values are preserved and preserved, while meeting the needs of domestic and foreign tourists to visit and learn. Conservation work is not only related to the protection of physical relics such as buildings and monuments, but also to the protection of documents and artifacts associated with the life of the Chairman Ton Duc Thang. These precious documents are not only historically valuable, but also vivid proof of his struggle and sacrifice throughout the revolutionary years. Architectures in the monument, from the house where the Chairman Ton Duc Thang was born, to the galleries, are regularly maintained and upgraded to preserve the characteristics and history of the relic. This restoration was meticulously carried out, with experts in relic preservation, to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the artifacts and relics in the monument. Every restoration, the relic is not only renewed but also restored and preserved to further promote educational and cultural value for future generations.

historicalEvents.title: Organize commemorative activities
historicalEvents.description: Every year, on the occasion of the Chairman's birthday Ton Duc Thang (August 20), the Memorial Zone organizes commemorative activities on a large scale, attracting a large number of people, local leaders, mass organizations and visitors from all over the world. These activities are not only an opportunity to commemorate the President Ton Duc Thang's achievements, but also an opportunity for the people and younger generations to understand more about the high values he has contributed to the country. Celebratory activities include memorial services, exhibitions, seminars, and cultural and artistic activities, such as singing and dancing, recreating historical moments in the life of the Chairman Ton Duc Thang. These activities provide a formal atmosphere and an opportunity to propagate about the tradition of patriotism, the spirit of solidarity and contribution to the career of defending the country. Organizing these commemorative activities helps people remember valuable lessons from the life of the President Ton Duc Thang and promote the nation's revolutionary, patriotic spirit, and contribute to strengthening confidence in the construction and protection of the Fatherland in the new era.

name: Van Mieu - Quoc Tu Giam
description: Literature Temple – Quoc Tu Giam (Hanoi) is a relic population associated with the history of Confucian education Vietnam: Literature Temple built in 1070 (Ly Thanh Tong), Quoc Tu Giam established in 1076 (Ly Nhan Tong). It is the place of worship Khong Tu, the first national school of Vietnam, which houses PhD beer, the signing system, and various artifacts related to the history of elective, educational and academic culture. Currently, the relic sites are managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and are an important destination for scientific research and cultural tourism.
location: District Ba Dinh and District Dong Da, City Hanoi

additionalInfo.architectural:
The Temple of Literature - Quoc Tu Giam is located in the south of the old Thang Long, now in the center of the district Dong Da, Hanoi. The architectural colony has an area of more than 54,000m ², including Ho Van, Temple Literature Zone - Quoc Tu Giam and Giamen, with its main architecture being the Temple of Literature - the place of worship Khong Tu, and Quoc Tu Giam - the first university of Vietnam. The entire current architecture is mostly palace style in the Nguyen Dynasty, surrounded by brick walls from the Hau Le era.

In front of the Temple of Literature is Ho Van (also known as Ho Giam) with Kim Chau Mound and the Thuy Duong Tranquillum - where in the past, monks commented on poetry. This area is considered a "minor road" in the overall architecture, associated with a harmonious landscape between nature and people. In front of the main gate is Tu Tru and two "Hara" beers that show the dignity of this place - both bureaucrats and aristocrats must get off their horses when passing through, showing respect for morality.

Literature Mieu Mon Gate (Three Views) is built on three floors, in the middle there is a sign with the three words "文廟門", the architecture is symmetrical and unique. Next is the Entrance Zone with the Dai Trung Mon Gate, on both sides are Thanh Duc Mon and Dat Tai Mon, symbolizing the dignity and talent of learners. The center of this area is Khue Van Cac, built in 1805 by the Town Governor Nguyen Van Thanh - the famous symbol of Hanoi today. Hang Khue Van has an architecture of eight roofs, four square pillars, a wooden floor covered with gold-plated paint, and a round door symbolizing star Khue - a symbol of intelligence and literature. Below the attic is Thien Quang Well, the square shape represents the soil, while Khue Van represents the sky - expressing the philosophy of harmony of yin and yang, the essence of heaven and earth lights up human learning.

On both sides of the well are 82 Ph.D. beers, which were built from 1484 (the reign of King Le Thanh Tong) to 1780. Each tablet lists those who passed Ph.D. through the departments of Nhoology Examination Le Dynasty - Nguyen, placed on the back of a stone turtle symbolizing the survival of knowledge. These beers are a World Heritage Site recognized by UNESCO, demonstrating the nation's tradition of filial piety and meritocracy.

Through this area are Dai Thanh Mon, the beginning of the main church area Khong Tu, Tu Doi (Nhanh Tu, Tang Tu, Tu Tu Tu, Manh Tu) and Ten Triet - the disciples and sages of Confucianism. The Dai Thanh Court is built in the form of "Cong", consisting of Dai Bai Duong and Thuong Dien connected with Tieu Dinh, has a Hau Le-era architectural style with comical roof tiles, limp wooden pillars, and simple and solemn carving.

On the last side is the Revelation Zone, where parents Khong Tu are worshiped. This area used to be the place where Thai Hoc House, the school Quoc Tu Giam - the highest educational institution of ancient Vietnam, where many talents were trained for feudal court. After being destroyed during the war, the Thai Hoc area was restored in 1999 on a large scale including the Tien Duong House and the two-story Hau Duong House, built of limp wood, traditional style comical roof tiles.

The Temple of Literature - Quoc Tu Giam is not only the largest educational and cultural center of Vietnam during the feudal period, but also the enduring symbol of nationalist filial piety. Today, this place is a famous tourist attraction of the Capital Hanoi, where the ceremony is held to honor excellent students and is a special national-level historical and cultural relic.

historicalEvents.title: Formation and construction period Quoc Tu Giam
historicalEvents.description:
Quoc Tu Giam, built in 1070 under the reign of Ly Thanh Tong, is the first university of Vietnam, to train officials and highly knowledgeable people for the imperial court. Quoc Tu Giam has been considered the nation's educational center for centuries.

Initially, Quoc Tu Giam was only a small school for officials' children, but gradually became a large, far-reaching educational institution. Built in the temple population Khong Tu, Quoc Tu Giam is not only an educational center but also a symbol of Confucian education, which houses the cultural and intellectual values of the Vietnamese people.

historicalEvents.title: The Ly dynasty (11th-13th century) – Quoc Tu Giam development and glory
historicalEvents.description:
During the Ly dynasty, Quoc Tu Giam flourished and became a training center for bureaucracy and official knowledge for the imperial court. The Ly dynasty, especially Ly Thanh Tong, valued Quoc Tu Giam very much, considered it a place to recruit talent for the country. Students here learn the subjects of literature, history, physics, and numbers, all of whom follow Confucianism and the ideological values of Khong Tu.

Along with the development of education, Quoc Tu Giam is also honored as the intellectual center of the country. Officials, intellectuals, and people who have made great contributions to society are respected and honored here. Quoc Tu Giam is also where the mandarin examinations take place, from which the best will be appointed officials in the court.

historicalEvents.title: The Chen period (13th-15th century) – Quoc Tu Giam became a symbol of knowledge
historicalEvents.description:
Throughout the Chen era, Quoc Tu Giam continued to grow and became a symbol of Confucian education in Vietnam. This is a period when Dai Viet's culture, science and education became very developed. Quoc Tu Giam is not only the learning place of officials' children, but also the place to attract well-known scholars and intellectuals in society.

During the Tran dynasty, many major exams took place in Quoc Tu Giam, attracting the participation of students from all over the country. These exams are not only aimed at selecting talented people to be officials, but also are an opportunity for the people to show their talents and education, thereby helping society to develop more vigorously.

historicalEvents.title: Hau Le period (15th-17th century) – Quoc Tu Giam under the patronage of the imperial court
historicalEvents.description:
During the Hau Le dynasty, Quoc Tu Giam continued to play an important role in fostering talent for the country. This dynasty especially focused on maintaining and developing education. Quoc Tu Giam become the place where the examinations are held, these examinations are a great opportunity for people to advance in society.

Now, Quoc Tu Giam not only train students in Confucian culture but also focus on more practical subjects, which are related to national management, military techniques, legal and other areas, to meet the country's development needs.

historicalEvents.title: Nguyen Dynasty (19th century) – Quoc Tu Giam moved to the conservation stage
historicalEvents.description:
In the period Nguyen Dynasty, Quoc Tu Giam began to enter the stage of preserving and maintaining their cultural and educational values. Although Nguyen Dynasty has moved to a new regime and there have been many changes in education, Quoc Tu Giam has maintained an important role in promoting and preserving traditional values of the nation.

Under Nguyen Dynasty, some works at Quoc Tu Giam have been upgraded and preserved. Traditional rituals and exams are also maintained. Although it is no longer a bureaucratic training center as before, Quoc Tu Giam still serves as a historical and cultural relic, which honors the traditional cultural values of the nation Vietnam.

historicalEvents.title: After the August Revolution 1945 - Quoc Tu Giam became a national monument
historicalEvents.description:
After the August Revolution of 1945, Quoc Tu Giam became an important national relic of Vietnam, a place to preserve traditional cultural values and a place to visit and study for future generations. During this period, Quoc Tu Giam was not only a place of worship but also a symbol of the nation's traditional education.

Works at Quoc Tu Giam have been restored and preserved, preserving the ancient architectural beauty. Each year, Quoc Tu Giam attracts thousands of visitors at home and abroad, becoming an indispensable destination in the journey to learn about history and culture Vietnam.

name: Independence Palace
description: Independence Palace (District 1, city. Ho Chi Minh) is a political-historical architecture that served as the headquarters of the government Saigon before 1975 and then as a symbol of many modern historical events. The palace consists of a complex of architecture, functional rooms, and space to display items and artifacts related to political history in the 20th century at Vietnam. Currently, the relic sites are managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and are an important destination for scientific research and cultural tourism.
location: District 1, City Ho Chi Minh

historicalEvents.title: The time Vietnam the Republic
historicalEvents.description: Independence Palace is now commissioned by President Ngo Dinh Diem to start construction on July 1, 1962, after the old palace from the French colonial era was damaged by the bombing of two pilots. Ninh was built according to the design of architect Ngo Viet Thu, who Vietnam first won the Roman Prize. During construction,President Ngo Dinh Diem's family temporarily moved to Dinh Gia Long. The construction was under construction when Ngo Dinh Diem was assassinated by the coup d'état faction on November 2, 1963. Therefore, the inauguration date of the palace, October 31, 1966, was Nguyen Van Thieu, Chairman of the National Steering Committee. From this day,The newly built Independence Palace became the residence and workplace of the president Vietnam Republic. President Nguyen Van Thieu lived in this residence from October 1967 to April 21, 1975. On April 8, 1975, the F-5E plane driven by pilot Nguyen Thanh Trung, from Bien Hoa, bombed Dinh to assassinate President Nguyen Van Thieu,caused negligible damage. At 10:45 p.m. on April 30, 1975, the T54B tank No. 843 of the People's Army under Lieutenant Bui Quang Xien pushed the auxiliary gate of Independence Palace, followed by the Type 59 tank No. 390 commanded by Vu Dang Toan, which drove the main gate into the palace.At 11:30 p.m. on the same day, Lieutenant General of the Liberation Army Bui Quang Xien, commander of the 843, lowered the flag Vietnam Republic on the roof of the palace, hoisted the flag of the Southern Liberation National Front Vietnam, ending 20 years of war Vietnam

historicalEvents.title: After 1975
historicalEvents.description: After the political negotiation conference between the two Koreas to unify into a unified Vietnam country took place at Independence Palace in November 1975. The current Cultural Heritage Administration Independence Palace is called Unification Hall of Administration II - Government Office.This is a famous cultural historical site visited by a large number of domestic and foreign tourists. This place is recognized as a National Cultural Historical Site at Decision No. 77A/VHTHHHTH dated 25 June 1976 by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism (Ministry of Today).The Prime Minister of the Socialist Republic Vietnam signed Decision No. 1272/QD-TTg ranking Historical Site Independence Palace as one of Vietnam's first 10 special national monuments on August 12, 2009. Today,Independence Palace became one of the indispensable tourist destinations for each citizen arriving in Ho Chi Minh City. Not only has historical significance, but Independence Palace also shows the typical architecture of Vietnam in the 1960s. Independence Palace is often the place where major events take place in the city,Party and State receptions in Ho Chi Minh City as well as the city government. At the same time, it is the venue for national mourning for Party and State leaders in Ho Chi Minh City and the final stop of the annual HTV Cup race.

historicalEvents.title: History of formation and development
historicalEvents.description: Independence Palace is not only a unique architecture but also a symbol of history, of the aspirations for freedom, independence and unity of the nation Vietnam. Every single brick, every corner of Independence Palace is associated with historical stories, witnessing the great changes of the country. Preserving and promoting the value of Independence Palace not only helps the younger generation better understand the history of the nation, but also helps to preserve and promote the precious cultural and historical values of the nation Vietnam.

historicalEvents.title: Importance of Independence Palace
historicalEvents.description: Independence Palace is not only a unique architecture but also a symbol of history, of the aspirations for freedom, independence and unity of the nation Vietnam. Every single brick, every corner of Independence Palace is associated with historical stories, witnessing the great changes of the country. Preserving and promoting the value of Independence Palace not only helps the younger generation better understand the history of the nation, but also helps to preserve and promote the precious cultural and historical values of the nation Vietnam.

name: National Park Phong Nha - Ke Bang
description: The National Park Phong Nha - Ke Bang (Quang Binh) is a global geological and ecological conservation area, known for its limestone cave system, biodiversity and ancient geographical values. The region was first recognized by UNESCO in 2003 and has been expanded, reported on conservation, tourism management and scientific research for the following years; it contains large caves of scientific and tourist value. Currently, the relic sites are managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and are an important destination for scientific research and cultural tourism.
location: District Bo Trach and district Minh Hoa, province Quang Binh

historicalEvents.title: National Park Formation Period Phong Nha - Ke Bang
historicalEvents.description: The national park Phong Nha - Ke Bang has a history of being formed millions of years ago, when limestone mountains in this area began to be formed through geological formation. Large caves and systems of stalactite and stalagmites here began to appear in the Jurassic period, about 400 million years ago. During geological development, magnificent caves and special ecosystems were created, thus creating the world's most abundant system of agar. These areas have become home to many species of plants and animals, especially rare wildlife. The land has formed special geological factors, contributing to one of the most important natural reserves Vietnam.

historicalEvents.title: First Discovery and Recognition (19th century)
historicalEvents.description: Although locals have long known about caves in Phong Nha, it was not until the end of the 19th century that Western explorers began to explore and record the area. In 1899, a French surveyor named Aymonier visited the Phong Nha area and made preliminary studies of caves here, including the Cave Phong Nha, which was said to be one of the largest and most beautiful caves in Southeast Asia at the time. Then, many other explorers and scientists from France and Western countries came to study the region's special cave systems, ecology, and topography. These records have helped put Phong Nha in the world's geographic and exploration maps.

historicalEvents.title: Phong Nha - Ke Bang become a nature reserve (1990)
historicalEvents.description: With the discovery and recognition of special nature values, Phong Nha - Ke Bang were decided by the Government Vietnam to establish a nature reserve in 1990. This decision marks an important turning point in the protection and sustainable development of the region. The main purpose is to preserve the region's unique biodiversity and geological value. Local governments, along with domestic and foreign conservation organizations, have developed environmental protection measures, including the control of tourism, resource extraction and infrastructure development. At the same time, scientists and wildlife conservationists have conducted extensive studies to monitor the development of species and ensure that Phong Nha - Ke Bang maintains the ecosystem intact.

historicalEvents.title: Phong Nha - Ke Bang recognized as a World Natural Heritage Site (2003)
historicalEvents.description: One of the most notable events in the history of the National Park Phong Nha - Ke Bang was in 2003, when UNESCO designated the area as a World Natural Heritage Site. This recognition is based on geological values unique to the region, including the system of large caves, rich ecosystems, and rare biodiversity. Phong Nha – Ke Bang has a cave system with dozens of large caves, including the longest, deepest and most beautiful caves in the world such as Hang Son Doong, Hang Phong Nha, Hang Tien, and many others. This recognition is not only the pride of Vietnam but also a great motivation for protecting and developing the region, while attracting the attention of international tourists and scientific researchers.

historicalEvents.title: Phong Nha – Ke Bang and sustainable (current) tourism development
historicalEvents.description: Over the years, Phong Nha - Ke Bang has become one of Vietnam's most popular ecotourism destinations. In particular, Hang Son Doong, considered the world's largest cave, has attracted thousands of international visitors. However, with the rapid development of tourism, the Government and international conservation organizations have focused on sustainable tourism development, ensuring that the region's natural environment and ecosystem are not affected. Strict travel protection and regulations have been introduced to limit the negative impact of tourism, while creating economic benefits for the local community. Visitors to Phong Nha - Ke Bang not only get to visit mysterious caves, but also have the opportunity to explore the rich ecosystem of rainforests, along with activities such as trekking, exploration, camping and learning the culture of ethnic minorities.

historicalEvents.title: Conservation and research efforts at Phong Nha – Ke Bang
historicalEvents.description: Phong Nha – Ke Bang is an area that continues to receive attention and research from domestic and foreign scientists. Nondisruptive conservation efforts have been made to maintain biodiversity and protect rare animals in the region, especially animals such as apes, leopards, tigers and elephants. Research programs on wildlife, plants, along with geological research and cave exploration continue. Scientists constantly explore and discover new caves, and also note changes in the ecosystem to provide reasonable protection solutions. In addition, community education on environmental protection and sustainable tourism development is being carried out to raise public awareness in protecting this natural heritage.

name: The Chairman's monument Ho Chi Minh at Phu Chu chairman
description: The monument and collection area Phu Chu the chairman (Hanoi) includes Phu Chu the chairman's Ho Chi Minh, the chairman's Lang Uncle Ho, the floor Uncle Ho, the garden, and auxiliary structures. It is an important national relic that keeps artifacts, documents related to the life, activities and ideology of the Chairman Ho Chi Minh, and is also the place where national ceremonial activities take place. This area has great historical, cultural and educational value, is strictly protected and serves research and propaganda on the history of revolution. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: District Ba Dinh, city Hanoi

historicalEvents.title: The chairman Ho Chi Minh moved to Phu Chu the chairman worked
historicalEvents.description: In 1954, after the historic victory of Dien Bien Phu, the Chairman Ho Chi Minh returned Hanoi from the North Vietnamese battle zone and officially transferred to Phu Chu president to work. Despite the large and comfortable accommodation in the Palace, Uncle Ho refused, chose to live in a small house and later a simple floor house next to the Palace. This event deeply demonstrates his clear lifestyle, close to his people, and the beginning of his leadership period from the heart of the Capital.

historicalEvents.title: Building a Floor Uncle Ho
historicalEvents.description: In 1958, according to the wishes of the Chairman Ho Chi Minh, the wooden floor house was started construction on the campus Phu Chu the president. The floor house is only about 10 square meters, with a style of Northwest ethnic minority stilt house. This is where He lives, works daily, receives guests at home and abroad, and deeply expresses his thoughts of 'near the people' and 'living for the people'. The stilt house has become an immortal symbol of Uncle Ho's personality and simplicity.

historicalEvents.title: Event of the Chairman Ho Chi Minh's death
historicalEvents.description: On September 2, 1969, at Building No. 108 on the Phu Chu residential area, the Chairman Ho Chi Minh breathed his last breath after his critical illness. The news of his death touched the hearts of millions of people Vietnam and international friends. The whole nation is filled with endless sorrow and sorrow. Room where His uncle's death is preserved intact, as a sacred relic to posterity to remember and appreciate his great service.

historicalEvents.title: Open the souvenir shop to welcome visitors
historicalEvents.description: After the country's reunification in 1975, the Presidential Memorial Zone Ho Chi Minh at Phu Chu were officially opened to fellow citizens and international visitors to visit, learn about his life, thoughts and style. The opening of the monument not only helps future generations to better understand Uncle Ho, but also arouse patriotism, national pride and inspire generations to follow the glorious path of revolution of the nation Vietnam.

historicalEvents.title: Restoration, preservation and cultivation of the monument
historicalEvents.description: Over the years, our State has carried out many stages of restoration, preservation and cultivation of the monument to ensure that this historical space always retains its original and sacred appearance. Conservation activities focus on restoring the original state of the floor house, fish pond, orchard as well as the in-kind system associated with the life and work of the Chairman Ho Chi Minh. This work shows deep respect for Uncle Ho, while contributing to preserving invaluable heritage for future generations.

name: The tombs and temples of kings Ly Dynasty
description: The tombs and temples of kings Ly Dynasty are relics associated with the king Ly Dynasty (XII century), including worship, tombs, and memorial facilities. These relics reflect the beliefs, court rituals, and architectural art, Ly dynasty sculpture; they are an important source of research on medieval history and culture in Vietnam. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: City Tu Son, province Bac Ninh

additionalInfo.architectural: Do Temple is 31,250 m ², with over 20 construction categories, divided into 2 areas: inner and outer cities. All are elaborately constructed, with elaborate carvings. The inner city area has architecture in the style of "foreign interior." The inner gate is called the Five Dragons-shaped station.The center of the inner city and also the center of the temple is the electricity itself. It is the electricity consisting of Phuong Dinh (square house) 8 3-bay wide to 70 m ². Next, the Prefect's house 7 rooms wide to 220 m ². There is the king's temple Ly Thai To.On the left side of the shrine, a plaque bearing the king's "Movement Projection" Ly Thai To, which is considered the largest ceramic projection Vietnam with a height of 3.5 meters, rộng more than 8 meters, is attached from 214 Chinese characters made of Bat Trang pottery.On the right side, there is a board with a famous poem written in South Vietnam Son Ha: "South Son Nhan Emperor Nhu Ngoi Ngoi's fate in heaven, playing with hybrid holes encroaching on the corrupt Khanh Phap dynasty." Finally, there are 7 rooms wide 180 m ² where the throne, tablets, and statues of 8 kings Ly Dynasty are located.The middle section is where the shrine Ly Thai To and Ly Thai Tong are located; the three sections on the right are Ly Thanh Tong, Ly Than Tong and Ly Cao Tong respectively; the three sections on the left are Ly Nhan Tong, Ly Anh Tong, and Ly Hue Tong respectively. In the inner city, there is also a house with 8.8 soft curved roof, preceptre, a shrine, and a church for pony.On the east side of the temple is a beer house, where "Kha Tung Bi Temple Site" (Kha Phu Phuoc Bi Temple Beer" is located. This stone tablet is 190 cm tall, rộng 103 cm, 17 cm, built in 1605), written by Dr. Phung Khac Khoan, recording the historical event Le Dynasty rebuilding the temple and the virtues of kings Ly Dynasty The Duong Duong Duong Duong Duong Duong Dien Duong Thien Duong Thu Thuoc Thuoc Thuoc Nguyen Thien Nguyen Thien Nguyen.This is a place for civil servants to sit and watch a water puppet show. This lake is connected to both the upper pond and the lower pond and the old Tieu Tuong River. The 5-bay northern lake has an architecture with 8 roofs and 8 curved blades.Do temple was once selected by the Indochina Bank in French times as the image printed on the "five gold coins" and as the image printed on the current 1000 coin. The writer only three compartments of matches 100 m wide ² located on the left side of the inner city of To Hien Thanh and Ly Dao Thanh, officials have greatly helped Ly Dynasty.The martial arts house only has the same architecture as the author, only on the right side of the inner city area of Le Phung Hieu, Ly Thuong Kiet, Dao Cam Moc, the officials of martial arts have helped Ly Dynasty. In addition, there are ritual houses, warehouses, guest houses and king temples in the suburbs. She (the shrine of Li Chia Huang, also known as the Dragon Temple), etc.

historicalEvents.title: Ly Cong Uan the dashboard moved the capital back to Thang Long (1010)
historicalEvents.description: The event Ly Cong Uan issued the Capital Relocation Project from Hoa Lu to Dai La, renamed to Thang Long, opened a glorious era for the country, and laid a solid foundation for Dai Viet's long-term development. After the establishment of the new dynasty, the homeland of Co Phap (where Ly Dynasty was discovered) has always been valued by the court, where ancestors were worshiped and memorialized. It was in this land that tombs and temples of Ly kings were built to commemorate the origin, marking a deep appreciation for the ancestors.

historicalEvents.title: Construction of ancestral shrines and tombs Ly Dynasty (9th century)
historicalEvents.description: Immediately after Ly Cong Uan ascended the throne, the court built a system of temples and tombs in its hometown of Co Phap (now Bac Ninh) to commemorate their ancestors Ly and the founding kings of the dynasty. The construction was built on a large scale, demonstrating the morality of 'drinking water remembering the source' and honoring the virtues of ancestors. This area became the venue for the royal court's great ritual for generations, clearly expressing the filial spirit of the Vietnamese people at that time.

historicalEvents.title: Ancestral rites Ly Dynasty through the ages of kings
historicalEvents.description: Since the time Ly Cong Uan, successive kings such as Li Taejong, Ly Thanh Tong, Ly Nhan Tong... both continue to hold ancestral rites at the temple site and the tomb of their fatherland. These ceremonies are not only ancestral memorials, but also an occasion for the court to confirm the sacred origin of the Ly family, strengthen the loyalty of its people and instill national pride in the context of increasingly prosperous country.

historicalEvents.title: The event of temples and tombs being ruined over time
historicalEvents.description: Through many historical events, tombs and temples of kings Ly Dynasty were once devastated by war, natural disasters and the demise of time. Many ancient architectures have disappeared or been badly damaged.
