However, the historical meaning and spiritual value of the relic are always preserved in the folk spirit, so that centuries later, the restoration and reformation helped the relic revive, becoming a sacred destination, connecting the memories of generations.

historicalEvents.title: Reconstruction and recognition of relics (XX-XXI century)
historicalEvents.description: With a keen awareness of historical and cultural values, restoration, tomb restoration, and temples of kings Ly Dynasty were carried out in the 20th and 21st centuries. Historians and archaeologists have been constantly making efforts to restore the relics, based on historical records and remains. In 2010, on the occasion of the 1000th anniversary of Thang Long - Hanoi, the relic site was given special attention and honored as an integral part of the nation's journey to build and keep water.

name: The ancient capital Hoa Lu
description: The ancient capital Hoa Lu (Ninh Binh) was the first capital of the feudal state to exercise Dai Co Viet power under the Dinh dynasty and Tien Le (the end of the 15th century – the beginning of the 11th century). The population consists of King Dinh - Le temple, walls and many auxiliary monuments; it has historical value for forming an independent Vietnam state after the Northern period, as well as religious architectural value and natural scenery. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: City Hoa Lu, province Ninh Binh

additionalInfo.architectural: The city Hoa Lu consists of East, West and South citadel. However, because Nam is only a rough military base area, its back defense is often called Trang An citadel, the other 2 rings are also called Hoa Lu. The dynasties based on natural terrain for 10 sections of walls connecting rocks,The city Hoa Lu belongs to Truong Yen commune with an area of more than 300 hectares. To the south, Trang An city is the capital's rear defense area. The city Hoa Lu has many pedestrian gates to enter, besides the water gate flowing through the city by the Hang Khe River. The city Hoa Lu has two rings close together: the outer perimeter called Dong,The inner city is called West Castle. The Dong city is about 140 hectares wide, located in the east, so it is also called an outer city or an outer city, now in the territory of Yen Thanh ancient villages and Yen Thuong ancient villages, there are 5 sections of walls connecting the mountains forming a closed castle. The Outer city is the court's daily workplace Hoa Lu.This is the main palace where the area of King's Temple Dinh Tien Hoang, King's Temple Le Dai Hanh is located in the center. Thanh Dong now has many landmarks such as Dong Bridge, Dien Bridge, Nhat Tru pagoda, Co Am pagoda, Dong Vuong government, Yen Trach, Ma Yen Mountain, Hoan Mountain Flag Tower and Hang Khe River (from Dien Bridge).Thanh Tay is about the same area and is located west of Dong City, in the ancient village of Chi Phong, there are also 5 sections of the fortress wall connecting the mountain ranges: The West Castle is home to the king's family and some royal family and high officials. In addition to the king and officials are entitled to reside above,Outside and inside, there are also barracks of 3,000 prohibited troops to protect the king and court; the people are only allowed to stay outside the city. Currently, relics such as Kim Ngan pagoda, the former gold and national treasury, Duyen Ninh pagoda is a bridge pagoda, Bim temple, Vuong Vong temple, etc.The crossing between the two cities is very convenient. Both cities take advantage of the advantages of the Hang Khe River flowing along the city, as well as the natural trench, as well as the waterway, for the movement of the city to and from. A total city consists of two separate cities, very convenient for arranging each court area, officers or soldiers.However, the crossing between the two cities is not an obstacle. Nature has cleverly arranged a discreet but convenient road, which is Vuong Vong, the border between Hang Sung Mountain and Phuong Dau Mountain. In each city, there is also a short section of walls that can be divided into two parts, increasing the level of the risk of the construction.Trang An City is located in the south of the capital city Hoa Lu, so it is also called Nam City, which is larger than the other two cities. Trang An City with high mountains, hào deep mountains, protects the back of the city Hoa Lu, from which soldiers can quickly move in and out by water. Trang An now has many relics describing the defensive layout of the capital Hoa Lu.Here archaeologists also excavated traces of prehistoric people and many artifacts from the Dinh, Tien Le and Tran dynasty. In the later Tran dynasty, this place continued to be an anti-Mong forces base. Currently, this is an ecotourism - history route attracting many geological and historical researchers to work.The Joseon Dynasty was founded after thousands of years of North Korea, when Han Chinese-style building models that were immediately written, formal direction, and construction became formulas, grew in many places. But it was a unique Hoa Lu that was rebuilt without a Chinese pattern of any time. As a military base.Hoa Lu has reached the peak of a defensive build, hiểm back. Hoa Lu is considered a rare military build in the history of Vietnam and also in the history of other contemporary countries. Hoa Lu is a typical building for a construction method that takes advantage of natural terrain. Because of this, Hoa Lu has a unique shape.The rugged, rugged nature of a military structure adds to the magnificence and sensibility of a scenic landscape. Currently, natural and artificial cities and palaces are only remains to be excavated. Archaeologists dug up some of the walls discovered in these areas with branches with many piles and deep.The inside of the brick wall is 0.45 m thick, 8-10 m high. The foot of the wall is embanked with rock, brick, and wooden stake. The common brick is 30 x 16 x 4 cm in size, with the words "Great Vietnam Army specialized" and "West Army" written on the wall. The outside of the wall is very thickly covered with soil.

historicalEvents.title: Dinh Bo Linh unify the country and establish a Dai Co Viet
historicalEvents.description: In the chaotic period after the Ngo Dynasty weakened, the country fell into a state of division with 12 sandmans everywhere. Dinh Bo Linh, with outstanding tactical skills, conquered these forces in turn, united the country in 968. He ascended the throne, entitled Dinh Tien Hoang, named the country Dai Co Viet and chose Hoa Lu as the capital. The selection of Hoa Lu with its rugged mountainous terrain as a place of business has demonstrated the founding king's strategic vision, laying a solid foundation for the long-term development of the nation Vietnam.

historicalEvents.title: The coronation of Dinh Tien Hoang at Hoa Lu
historicalEvents.description: In 968, after the pacification of the legions and reunification of the country, Dinh Bo Linh held a solemn coronation in capital Hoa Lu. This is an event of special historical significance, marking the birth of the first collective feudal state in Vietnam. The coronation ceremony represents the legitimacy of a new dynasty, while affirming the sovereignty and national sovereignty after more than a thousand years of being colonized and divided. This event also opened a new era of independence and the construction of the Great Co Viet nation.

historicalEvents.title: The Tien Le take over and rule The ancient capital Hoa Lu
historicalEvents.description: Sau khi Đinh Tiên Hoàng bị ám sát vào năm 979, Lê Hoàn đã được suy tôn lên ngôi, lập nên nhà Tiền Lê. Ông tiếp tục lấy Hoa Lư làm trung tâm chính trị và quân sự, củng cố nền độc lập dân tộc. Dưới triều Tiền Lê, đặc biệt là với chiến thắng chống quân Tống xâm lược năm 981, Hoa Lư không chỉ là kinh đô mà còn là thành lũy vững chắc bảo vệ đất nước. Việc duy trì và phát triển Hoa Lư trong thời kỳ này góp phần ổn định nền tự chủ và khẳng định vị thế Đại Cồ Việt trên bản đồ khu vực Đông Nam Á.

historicalEvents.title: Ly Cong Uan move the capital from Hoa Lu to Thang Long
historicalEvents.description: In 1010, finding that Hoa Lu was in a precarious position but unfavorable for economic development and communication with other regions, Ly Cong Uan – the founder of Ly Dynasty – had issued a decree relocating the capital from Hoa Lu to Dai La, changing its name to Thang Long. The relocation of the capital represents a strategic vision of the country's long-term and sustainable development. Hoa Lu has since ended its role as a political capital, but remains forever remembered as the first cradle of independence Vietnam after more than a thousand years of Northern independence.

name: Safety Zone (ATK) Dinh Hoa
description: Regional Safety (ATK) Dinh Hoa (Thai Nguyen) is a resistance base area during the anti-French and early anti-American era, where agencies, printing factories, revolutionary schools, and revolutionary leaders' lives are located. The ATK has a tent station system, a workhouse, and relics that hold historical artifacts, reflecting the life, organization and activities of the local revolutionary movement. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: District Dinh Hoa, province Thai Nguyen

historicalEvents.title: Base of resistance during the years against France
historicalEvents.description:
Safety zone Dinh Hoa is one of the landmarks in the resistance against France. This area was chosen as the base of the Government Vietnam Republican Democracy and was a safe haven for leaders during the early years of the war. As the war against France entered a fierce phase, the government had to move several times from Hanoi to rural areas, and ATK Dinh Hoa became one of the key points in ensuring the safety of senior leaders.

In 1947, ATK Dinh Hoa was selected as a safety base after military strategies were no longer able to protect leaders in other regions. With its rugged mountainous location and difficult traffic, this area not only has a strategic advantage but also creates an environment that is difficult to detect and protect the safety of Party and Government agencies. It was here that important instructions and strategies for war were born, including plans related to major campaigns such as the 1950 Border Campaign.

With the leadership of the Chairman Ho Chi Minh and Resistance Command, ATK Dinh Hoa became the home of many important meetings, which decided resistance strategies and plans to deal with French colonial aggression. It is not only a venue for military meetings but also a venue for exchanges between leaders, Party and State agencies, and promotes solidarity between military forces and the people during these years of tough resistance.

historicalEvents.title: The formation and development of ATK Dinh Hoa during the war period
historicalEvents.description:
Since the outbreak of the resistance war against France, ATK Dinh Hoa have played an important role in helping the government and the Republican Democratic Vietnam army reorganize their forces and fight the attack of French colonial troops. After French troops occupied many big cities such as Hanoi and Hai Phong, the Government Vietnam Republican Democrats were forced to withdraw to rural areas to protect their safety and continue the resistance.

Surrounded by rugged mountains and difficult transportation systems, ATK Dinh Hoa has become the ideal shelter for the government and military. During this time, the ATK Dinh Hoa was not only the place to protect the leadership but also the command center of major military operations. This is the focal point of key leaders in the Party and the State, which formulates long-term resistance strategies. Although the ATK Dinh Hoa is a secret military base, it is also the center of cultural life, which organizes propaganda, political and military education activities for the entire resistance force.

From 1947 to 1954, ATK Dinh Hoa served as one of the most important military bases during the resistance war against France. Important meetings and conferences between Party, State and military commanders took place here, deciding on war and political strategies to help regain national independence.

historicalEvents.title: ATK Dinh Hoa during the Warring States Period
historicalEvents.description:
During the period of the war against the U.S., although the war situation has changed, ATK Dinh Hoa has played an important role in protecting the leadership and is a strong support for the people's resistance Vietnam. After the country was divided into two Koreas, the North and the South, and the war continued to escalate, the ATK Dinh Hoa area remained an important site of the South's liberation struggle, reunification.

With a comprehensive strategy, from diplomacy to military, the Party and the Government Vietnam the Democratic Republic of Korea have continued to use the ATK Dinh Hoa as a safe base to provide instructions and action plans against the U.S. invasion war. Although it is no longer the main base in the years of the war against the U.S., the ATK Dinh Hoa still had a great influence on directing and running military operations during the war and helping to boost the great struggle for national independence.

historicalEvents.title: Historical and cultural preservation relics at ATK Dinh Hoa
historicalEvents.description:
After the war ended and Vietnam gained independence, ATK Dinh Hoa became an important historical landmark, which deeply imprinted the resistance and contributed greatly by the military and people Vietnam in the country's liberation. The relics at ATK Dinh Hoa currently retain extremely important cultural and historical values, which are a place where valuable historical documents on the resistance against France are preserved.

In the 2000s, the ATK relic Dinh Hoa was recognized as a special National Historic Landmark. Buildings here, such as the Memorial Hall, Resistance sites, and old base areas, are preserved intact and become indispensable attractions for domestic and foreign tourists. It is not only a tourist attraction but also a revolutionary traditional education center, which inspires young generations to learn about national history, about sacrifices and victories in the national war.

name: Bach Dang
description: The relic population Bach Dang (river's edge Bach Dang, provinces Quang Ninh – Quang Yen) is associated with many representative historical battles against aggression, of which the victories Bach Dang of 938, 981 and 1288 were important milestones in military history Vietnam. The relic site includes temples, temples, memorial milestones and topographical traces related to naval battles; has great historical, cultural and military value. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: Town Quang Yen, city Uong Bi, province Quang Ninh

historicalEvents.title: The battle Bach Dang 938 – Ngo Quyen and the victory over the South Han army
historicalEvents.description: The Battle of Bach Dang in 938 was one of the most important battles in Vietnam history, which took place at the end of the X century, when the South Han army invaded Dai Viet. At this time, after more than 1,000 years under the rule of the Northern feudal dynasties, the people Vietnam are determined to regain their independence. Ngo Quyen, one of the great generals of the Wu Dynasty, was the one who led the army against the invasion of the South Han army. With ingenious tactics, Ngo Quyen has put wooden stakes along the riverbed Bach Dang, taking advantage of the special terrain of this river, where there is strong water and shallow water. When the Han Chinese entered the river, they could not foresee the danger from these wooden stakes. Ngo Quyen used wooden stakes to intercept and destroy the entire fleet of the Han army. In the end, a resounding victory in Bach Dang helped Ngo Quyen regain Dai Viet's independence, ending more than a thousand years of Northern independence and opening a period of autonomy, beginning the Ngo dynasty.

historicalEvents.title: Battle Bach Dang 1288 – Tran Hung Dao and victory over the Nguyen-Mong army
historicalEvents.description: The Battle of Bach Dang in 1288 was one of the great battles in Dai Viet's resistance to Nguyen-Mong forces. After two unsuccessful attacks in 1258 and 1285, the Nguyen-Mong army, under Kublai Khan, again advanced to invade Dai Viet. However, the Nguyen army faced a different and brilliant strategy from the general Tran Hung Dao, who commanded the Great Vietnamese army against the invasion. This time, Tran Hung Dao has adopted an excellent naval strategy. He stationed wooden stakes in the riverbed Bach Dang, prepared to welcome Nguyen-Mong troops into the narrow river and seize the opportunity to attack. Equipped with warships, Dai Viet's army coordinated with wooden stakes, sinking the Nguyen army fleet, causing the Nguyen army to be completely destroyed. The battle Bach Dang 1288 became a legendary victory, helping Dai Viet maintain independence and affirming the strength of the army, especially the naval tactics superior to the invading army.

historicalEvents.title: Battle Bach Dang 1426 – Le Loi and victory over the Ming army
historicalEvents.description: The Battle of Bach Dang in 1426 took place in the context of the Ming army, led by King Minh, invading Dai Viet during the Sino-Dai Viet War. This war was part of the Lam Son uprising of Le Loi, who led the resistance movement to overthrow the Ming army. After years of hard fighting, Le Loi and Lam Son's army prepared for a decisive battle at river Bach Dang. Le Loi, along with the generals in the army, adopted a strategy of putting wooden stakes in the riverbed Bach Dang and using the water to completely destroy the Ming army. The meticulous preparation, combined with an understanding of the topography and flow of the river, helped Lam Son's army to win a great victory. The Battle of Bach Dang in 1426 helped Le Loi win the final victory, defeat the Ming army and restore independence for Dai Viet. After this victory, Le Loi ascended the throne, founding the dynasty Le Dynasty, beginning a prosperous period for the country.

historicalEvents.title: The historical significance of the battles Bach Dang
historicalEvents.description: Each battle at Bach Dang has deep historical significance and significance. The battle Bach Dang 938 opened an independent period for Dai Viet, ending more than a thousand years of Northern dependence. The battle Bach Dang 1288 and 1426 demonstrated the Vietnamese army's superior strength, wisdom and strategy in defending the country against invasion by the Northern empires. These victories not only protect the sovereignty of the country, but also affirm the patriotism, unity of the people Vietnam, and the pride of generations of descendants.

name: Historic population Hue Imperial City
description: Historic population Hue Imperial City (Thua Thien – Hue) is a World Heritage Site (UNESCO, 1993), including the Capital, the Imperial City, the Nguyen Dynasty mausoleum, temples, temples, and royal architecture. The population reflects the urban system of feudal palaces, architectural arts, decorations and rituals of Vietnam in the 19th century – early XX; and is also the cultural, religious and historical center of the central region. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: City Hue, town Huong Thuy, town Huong Tra, district Phu Vang, province Thua Thien Hue

additionalInfo.architectural:
The Gia Long tomb, also known as Thien Tho Lang, was built in 1814 and was not completed until 1820. The mausoleum is actually a mass of many tombs in the royal family. This entire mausoleum is a pair of painted trousers with 42 hills, large and small mountains, including Dai Thien Tho, the largest mountain chosen as the mausoleum's criminal record and the name of this whole mausoleum.

The tomb Minh Mang, also known as Hieu Lang, was built by King Thieu Tri from 1840 to 1843 to bury his father Minh Mang. Located on Cam Khe Mountain, near the Bang Lang junction, the mausoleum is where the Huu Trach and Da Trach rivers merge into the Huong River, 12 km from the ancient capital Hue.

Thieu Tri mausoleum, also known as Xuong Lang, is located in Cu Chanh village, Thuy Bang commune, Hue city. Built in 1847 by the king Tu Duc to bury his father, Thieu Tri. This is the only mausoleum facing northwest - a direction rarely used in palace and tomb architecture during the Nguyen Dynasty.

The tomb Tu Duc was built by the king himself Tu Duc while in office, is a collection of architectural works, including the burial place of the king Tu Duc located in a narrow valley in Duong Xuan Thuong village, now Thuy Xuan ward, Hue city. At the beginning of construction, the mausoleum was named Van Nien Co, later changed to Khiem Cung, and after Tu Duc died, changed to Khiem Lang.

Dong Khanh Mausoleum, also known as Tu Lang, is located in Thuong Hai village, Thuy Xuan ward, Hue city. The former was the Palace of Chau Tu built by King Dong Khanh to worship his father, Kien Thai Vuong. When Dong Khanh passed away, the next King Thanh Thai took the Chau Tu Palace to change it to Khoi Hy to worship Dong Khanh.

The name An Lang is located in An Lao ward, Hue city; it is the burial place of three kings Nguyen Dynasty: Duc Duc, Thanh Thai and Duy Tan.

The Khai Dinh mausoleum, also known as Ung Lang, is located on the slopes of Chau Giu mountain, which is the tomb of King Khai Dinh – the 12th king Nguyen Dynasty. The mausoleum has been built since 1920 and has a unique style of mixing East and West architecture.

Located in the eastern part of the capital city, Binh Tai is Hue, built in the 4th Gia Long (1805), originally called Thai Binh Tai, after the 13th Minh Mang year (1832). This is the 25th bastion of the city, the folk called the Manger Station.

Phu Van Lau is located on the main axis of the Imperial City Hue, in front of Ky Dai, built in 1819 under the reign of King Gia Long, used to list only the imperial court's examples and exam results.

The Silver Chambers, located on the south bank of the Huong River, was built in 1836 under the reign of King Tu Duc to welcome foreign emissaries.

The Temple of Literature (Hue), also known as the Temple of Literature, was built in 1808 under the reign of Gia Long, located on the banks of the Huong River, worshipped Khong Tu and set up a doctorate.

The Temple of Wushu (Hue) was started in 1835 during Minh Mang in An Ninh village, where the famous generals Vietnam and doctors Nguyen Dynasty were worshipped.

The Nam Giao herd was built in 1806 under Gia Long, moving south to Hue city, in Truong An ward. This is where the Nguyen kings sacrificed to heaven.

Built in 1830, the Tiger Fist is a arena between elephants and tigers for sacrificial rites and royal entertainment.

Elephant Ré Dien, located in Thuy Mau ward, Hue city, was built by King Gia Long to worship Nguyen Dynasty's brave war elephants.

Hon Grail Palace is located on Ngoc Tran Mountain, Huong Ho Ward, in the worship of St. Mary's Mother, Anna - the place where Cham and Viet beliefs are intermingled.

Thien Mu Pagoda, located on Ha Khe hill, on the left side of the Huong River, was built in 1601 during the reign of Lord Nguyen Hoang - the oldest temple Hue.

Hai Thanh Town was built in 1813 at the entrance of Thuan An Sea, as a citadel to protect the capital from the sea.

Nghe Luong Dinh was built in 1852 under Tu Duc, which is the place where the king rested and took a rest on the banks of the Huong River.

An Dinh Palace is located on the banks of the An Cuu River, built by the king Khai Dinh since he was Crown Prince; Bao Dai later lived here after his abdication.

historicalEvents.title: Date of establishment and construction Hue Imperial City
historicalEvents.description: Hue Imperial City, the political and cultural center of the Nguyen Dynasty, was built in the early 19th century under the direction of the king Gia Long. Built in 1805 and completed in 1832, the relic population includes the Imperial City, the Forbidden City, temples, mausoleums, pagodas, and ancient buildings. Hue became the capital of Vietnam under Nguyen Dynasty, and this was not only a symbol of power but also the cultural heart of the country. Every building in Hue Imperial City bears the artistic mark of the feudal period, combining traditional elements of the nation with the influence of Western culture, creating a harmonious, magnificent but also mysterious space. This relic population reflects the sophistication in the building art and creativity of architects at that time.

historicalEvents.title: Hue Imperial City - Symbols of power and culture
historicalEvents.description: During his 143 years as the capital of the Nguyen dynasty, Hue Imperial City is not only the residence of kings and royalty but also the center of political power, where important historical events of the nation take place. The relic population Hue was built for a very clear purpose: demonstrating the robustness of Nguyen Dynasty and feudal culture Vietnam. Buildings such as the Citadel, Ngo Mon, and the Palace of Thai Hoa are not only the living places of the king but also the symbol of supreme power. However, Hue Imperial City is also home to countless special cultural and artistic heritages, ranging from court music to exquisite paintings and sculptures. The relic population Hue has become an irreplaceable cultural icon, proving that somehow, art and culture always coexist with history, never fade away.

historicalEvents.title: Remembrance Hue Imperial City during the war
historicalEvents.description: Hue Imperial City go through many historical events, especially during the war. The 1968 Tet General Strike severely affected buildings in the relic site, as the U.S. military and Vietnam Republic bombed and devastated many parts of the city, including the Yellow City and the mausoleums. The destruction of war not only damaged part of ancient buildings, but also lost part of Hue culture. However, despite the devastation of the war, Hue Imperial City remains a witness of time, asserting the indomitable and resilient spirit of the people Vietnam. After the war, restoration and preservation of the relic population Hue became an important task, in order to preserve historical and cultural value for future generations.

historicalEvents.title: Recovery and preservation Hue Imperial City
historicalEvents.description: After the country's reunification, the preservation and restoration of relics at Hue Imperial City has been deployed vigorously. The government Vietnam, with the support of UNESCO and international organizations, have carried out numerous projects to restore war-torn buildings, temples, and mausoleums. Buildings such as Dai Noi, Ngo Mon, Dien Thai Hoa, and the tombs of Nguyen kings have been preserved intact or restored to their original shape. The conservation process is not simply about repairing structures, but it also includes the study and restoration of royal arts, musical traditions, dance, and rituals of Nguyen Dynasty. Hue Imperial City is now not only a historical relic but also a lively museum that preserves the unique cultural values of the people Vietnam.

historicalEvents.title: Historic population Hue Imperial City - World Cultural Heritage
historicalEvents.description: With exceptional historical, cultural and architectural value, the relic population Hue Imperial City was designated as a World Cultural Heritage by UNESCO in 1993. This is a recognition worthy of efforts to preserve and preserve the legacy of one of Vietnam's major cultural centers. The relic population Hue is not only a prominent tourist destination but also the pride of the people Vietnam. Every year, millions of domestic and foreign tourists visit and admire the ancient and magnificent beauty of works, while also learning about the rich history and culture of Hue. Recognition as a World Cultural Heritage helps to enhance the value of relics, provide opportunities for sustainable tourism development, while affirming the importance of preserving cultural heritage in the modern context.

name: Con Dao Prison
description: Con Dao Prison (Con Dao, Ba Ria – Vung Tau) is a relic population associated with the French-American and French prison systems; known for its history of political detention and repression. The prison areas, camps, tiger cage systems and stored artifacts show the harsh nature of the imprisonment regime, as well as a traditional place of memorial and education to fight for national liberation. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: District Con Dao, Province Ba Ria – Vung Tau

historicalEvents.title: Date of establishment Con Dao Prison
historicalEvents.description: Con Dao Prison, also known as 'the earthly hell', was built by French colonialists in 1862 to detain patriots and revolutionary soldiers against colonial rule. This is one of the most notorious prisons in history Vietnam, where thousands of revolutionary soldiers are held, including many important historical figures such as Nguyen An Ninh, Le Hong Phong, Phan Chau Trinh and many other leaders. The project was built on a remote island area of Con Dao, with the aim of preventing prisoners from escaping, and torturing them during their imprisonment. Con Dao Prison has become a symbol of brutality, of the suffering our people suffered during the French anti-colonial era, as well as a demonstration of the resilient, indomitable spirit of the revolutionary Vietnam fighters.

historicalEvents.title: Struggles in prison
historicalEvents.description: Con Dao Prison is not only the place of detention, but also the place where many hard-fought battles of revolutionary soldiers take place. During their years of captivity, the prisoners have constantly organized revolts, fought for the right to life, human rights and condemned the atrocities of the French colonialists. Despite being imprisoned in extremely harsh conditions, revolutionary soldiers maintained their faith in the cause of national liberation, refusing to give in to the enemy's brutal methods of torture. These struggles are not only a confirmation of the soldiers' unwavering will, but also a demonstration of the nation's strong spirit of solidarity and patriotism Vietnam.

historicalEvents.title: Political prisoner release historical milestone
historicalEvents.description: Con Dao Prison, throughout the course of history, numerous patriotic soldiers were detained, especially during the resistance against French colonialism. Although the colonial government was relentless in torturing the prisoners, it was impossible to reduce the will of Vietnamese children to fight. After the August Revolution was successful and the country gained independence, several political prisoners were released from prison Con Dao. This is an important historical milestone, marking the triumph of patriotism, the spirit of revolution. The release of political prisoners is not only meaningful for those directly imprisoned but also a great victory for the national liberation movement, which proves that despite the cruelty and injustice, the resistance of revolutionary soldiers will never be defeated.

historicalEvents.title: Preservation and promotion of relic value
historicalEvents.description: Con Dao Prison, after liberation and national unity, has been recognized as a national historical relic. With deep historical value, the site has been preserved and remodeled to preserve relics, artifacts, and traces of a dark period in history Vietnam. Conservation work not only stops at maintaining structures, but also includes the study, collection and storage of documents and photographs that record life in prison Con Dao, thereby helping future generations better understand the nation's painful struggle. Conservation activities are also aimed at strengthening traditional patriotic education and national solidarity, while providing opportunities for citizens and tourists to better understand the nation's painful and heroic past, thereby instigating national pride and indomitable and resilient spirit.

historicalEvents.title: Organization of commemorative activities and traditional education
historicalEvents.description: Every year, in Con Dao Prison, celebrations of the victory, Liberation Day, and other important historical events are held solemnly. These activities not only involve the government and mass organizations but also attract a large number of domestic and foreign tourists. Celebrations, exhibitions, seminars on the history of struggle and heroic mirrors were held here, to recreate the dark days that revolutionary soldiers had experienced. These activities have great significance in educating the young generation of patriotism, resilience and indomitable people. At the same time, it is also an opportunity to pay tribute to the heroes of martyrs who died in prisons, fighting for self-reliant freedom for the country. Education programs here not only help people understand more about history, but also cultivate patriotism, national pride and solidarity in building and protecting the country.

name: Hung Kings Temple
description: Hung Kings Temple (Phu Tho) is a relic population worshipping the Hung Kings - legendary figures who are considered to have contributed to the construction of the country. The relic site consists of many temples, shrines, and memorials located on Mt. Nghia Linh. The festival Hung Kings Temple is held annually (giỗ ) and is recognized as a National Intangible Cultural Heritage; the relic has great historical, religious and cultural value to the Vietnamese ethnic community. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: City Viet Tri, district Lam Thao, district Phu Ninh, province Phu Tho

historicalEvents.title: Legend has it that Le Loi return the Turtle Sword.
historicalEvents.description: Nguyen Trai's book, Lam Son, contains: At that time, Le Thai To and the person at Mu Son camp, Le Dien, were friends with paint glue. Kidney usually works as a fisherman. In the Monastery, the bottom of the water glows like a torch at night. Casting all night, fish get nothing. Only a piece of iron a foot longer, put it in the dark. One day, the King came to visit the house to celebrate the death of his parents. Seeing that there was light in the dark, recognizing the piece of iron, the king asked. The king asked for it, according to his kidney. Kidney right away. The king brought back to clean the rust, sharpen it to light, and found that it had the words "Thuan Thien", and the words "Luoi". Another day, the king went out to the door, saw a sharpened handle of the sword, the king prayed to God: Then he took the iron piece installed in the handle, and made a complete sword. The next day, the queen went out to look after the cabbage patch and saw four adult footprints, very wide and very large. The eldest queen, who came in to call the king to go to the garden, got the precious fruit, again with the words Thuan Thien (later used as a symbol) and Loi. The king secretly knew it was God's gift, he was glad and hid it without telling it. This legend goes into the textbook content of Vietnam and is written later, talking about Le Loi using that precious sword as a fighting sword, rushing to slaughter the enemy, beating the enemy to victory, eventually driving the Ming army home, Le Loi crowned king. In early 1428, Le Thai To and his subjects went to Ta Vong Lake with a boat. Upon receiving orders from Long Quan, the turtle floated to the surface of the water. By king's command, the boat slowed down. Standing on the side of the boat, the king saw the sword beside him move naturally. Turtle went to the king's boat and said: The King raised his sword towards the Golden Turtle. As quick as cutting, the turtle opened its mouth to bite the sword and dive into the water. Since then, Ta Vong Lake began to be named Sword Lake or Hoan Kiem Lake.

name: South Central Bureau Base
description: The Southern Department Central Base is the headquarters, housing and construction system serving the Southern Department's operation in the resistance against the US. These relics (in some southern provinces) retain traces of life, leadership, gathering and running the movement, and have high historical value in the study of revolutionary warfare in the South. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: District Tan Bien, province Tay Ninh

historicalEvents.title: South Central Bureau Base established
historicalEvents.description: The South Central Bureau base was established in the 1960s amid escalating war against the U.S. Located in the Tay Ninh area, this base was built to provide a strong foothold for the Southern Liberation National Front. It became the commanding and leading military, political and social activities of the revolutionary forces in the South. This base is not only a shelter for leaders, but also a place to make important decisions, leading the military strategy in the anti-U.S. resistance.

historicalEvents.title: The Southern Central Bureau leads major military operations
historicalEvents.description: Under the leadership of the Southern Central Bureau, many important military operations were directed. Among them, prominent campaigns such as the 1968 Tet Mau Than campaign and the Ho Chi Minh campaign were held from this base. The Tet holiday campaign is one of the most important in military history Vietnam, contributing to the weakening of the U.S. military and the administration Saigon. Commanders at the Central Bureau organized military operations under the strategy of attacking the enemy's key areas, creating fatal blows against the enemy, setting the stage for an important historical event in 1975.

historicalEvents.title: South Central Base Steady State Department Faced with Attacks
historicalEvents.description: During the resistance, the Southern Central Base repeatedly faced attacks from the US military and the Saigon military. These attacks were frequent but with guerrilla warfare tactics, soldiers at the base were resilient against aggression. The tenacity and consistency of the base have become a symbol of the indomitable spirit in the war. With structures such as underground bunkers and heavily designed defense systems, the Southern Central Base remained in command throughout the war.

historicalEvents.title: Victory over Xuan Loc and the end of the war
historicalEvents.description: Victory over Xuan Loc in April 1975 was one of the most important events related to the Southern Central Base. After this victory, the Southern Liberation Army gained the upper hand, headed straight into Saigon, ending the war and liberating the South. The Southern Central Branch is home to strategic decisions, coordinating offensive campaigns in this final stage, contributing to the nation's great success.

historicalEvents.title: The South Central Bureau has become a historical site.
historicalEvents.description: After the war ended, the Central Base of the Southern Bureau was preserved and became an important historical relic of the people Vietnam. It now attracts thousands of tourists every year, especially those who want to learn about the history of the war and the contributions of the South Korean military and people in the resistance against the U.S. Buildings such as underground tunnels, command areas, and relics restored at the base all became historical witnesses for a difficult but also heroic period of the nation.

name: Co Loa
description: Co Loa (Dong Anh, Hanoi) is an ancient castle with a long history associated with the legend An Duong Vuong and history into Co Loa - a military political center dating back to the An Duong Vuong era (the 3rd century BC according to legend and layers of archaeological culture). The relics include the system of earthen ramparts, temples, and archaeological artifacts; playing an important role in the study of ancient history and folk beliefs Vietnam. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: District Dong Anh, city Hanoi

historicalEvents.title: An Duong Vuong build up the capital Co Loa
historicalEvents.description: After defeating Thuc Quan and reunifying the tribes of Europe Viet and Lac Viet, An Duong Vuong decided to choose land Co Loa - which has favorable geographical location, semi-inflated terrain and many surrounding rivers - to build a new capital for the country of Eu Lac around the 3rd century BC. The Co Loa citadel was designed with a unique spiral structure, consisting of many loops integrated into each other, creating the first-tier solid defense system of the time. Legend has it that, for the construction of the castle, the king was helped by the god Kim Quy, and at the same time gave the magic turtle's claw as a crossbow, creating a crossbow that could destroy tens of thousands of enemy troops. The construction of the capital Co Loa not only shows the high level of social organization and military technology of the ancient Vietnamese, but also reflects the desire to rise to autonomy, independence, and build a strong nation in the early days of national history.

historicalEvents.title: The battle against Trieu Da and the failure of An Duong Vuong
historicalEvents.description: In the late 3rd century BC, after a period of construction and consolidation of Au Lac country, An Duong Vuong faced an invasion attack by Trieu Da - General of the Qin family, later claiming to be King of South Vietnam. Trieu Da used both force and stratagem to seize the divine crossbow, the ultimate weapon of the Euros. According to legend, Trong Thuy - son of Trieu Da - married My Chau, daughter An Duong Vuong, to steal the secret of the crossbow. When I lost my crossbow, the defensive power of the Co Loa collapsed. An Duong Vuong Great defeat, leading to the end of Au Lac country, and at the same time opening the stage of being annexed by South Vietnam. This war was not only a military defeat, but also left a deep historical lesson in vigilance against soft tricks and the danger of internal dehydration, becoming a painful but educational legend for future generations.

historicalEvents.title: My Chau - Trong Thuy legend and tragic dehydration
historicalEvents.description: My Chau - Trong Thuy story is associated with the fall of Co Loa, which has been handed down for generations as a tragic epic of love, betrayal, and dehydration. My Chau, the princess of An Duong Vuong, fell in love with Trong Thuy - the prince of South Vietnam. With her innocent love and absolute trust in her husband, she accidentally revealed the important military secrets of her country, resulting in Trong Thuy stealing the secret of making a crossbow. When the South Vietnamese attacked, Au Lac suffered a crushing defeat. An Duong Vuong, in despair, killed My Chow by the sea and killed herself. The story leaves humanistic lessons about loyalty to the country, sanity in love, and reminding each Vietnamese people of the responsibility to protect the young river and the young river. Today's relic Co Loa is not only the remains of an old city but also a witness to a heroic but tragic chapter of history in the nation's history.

historicalEvents.title: Co Loa under Northern dependence and symbolic meaning
historicalEvents.description: After Au Lac fell, the city of Co Loa no longer served as a center of political power but still existed as a symbol of the independent will and identity of Vietnamese culture. For more than a thousand years the North has belonged to, Co Loa has been referred to as a reminder of a golden age of autonomy, a symbol of the indomitable spirit and aspiration for national liberation. Major revolts such as those of Hai Ba Trung, Ba Trieu, or Ly Bi later all bear historical memories from the European era. Today, relic Co Loa with curvy rings of earth, legends of Kim Quy's crossbow, of An Duong Vuong, continues to live in the national consciousness, becoming a place to visit, study and educate the younger generation about patriotic traditions, fight foreign invaders, and preserve national identity Vietnam.

name: The battlefield Dien Bien Phu
description: The battlefield Dien Bien Phu (Dien Bien) was the site of the decisive campaign in 1954, ending the First Indochina War, with the victory of the Viet Minh force against the French. The area includes the field system, civil service, martyr's cemetery and monuments; has military historical value and is a revolutionary traditional educational address for the public. Currently, the location is managed and preserved in accordance with the regulations of the authorities and for research, education and cultural tourism.
location: City Dien Bien Phu, district Dien Bien and Tuan Khoi district, province Dien Bien

historicalEvents.title: Victory Dien Bien Phu 1954 - The decisive event in the resistance against France
historicalEvents.description: The Dien Bien Phu victory, which took place from March 13 to May 7, 1954, was one of the great historic victories in the nation Vietnam's resistance to French colonialism. This was the decisive battle of the First Indochina War, which marked the complete defeat of the French army, while affirming the strength of the People's Army Vietnam and the brilliant leadership of the President Ho Chi Minh and army generals Vietnam. Dien Bien Phu became a symbol of the courage, unity, and determination of the entire nation Vietnam in the struggle for independence. Under the command of the General Vo Nguyen Giap, the army Vietnam used a people's war tactic, along with the power of popular sentiment, to defeat one of the world's most powerful military forces at the time. Dien Bien Phu is not only a military victory, but also a spiritual victory, a great pride of the nation, proving that a small country with tenacity, unity, and determination to defend independence, freedom can defeat all enemies of aggression. This battle opened a turning point in the resistance against France, putting an end to French colonial rule and facilitating the parties involved in negotiations to end the war at the 1954 Geneva Conference.

historicalEvents.title: Dien Bien Phu and Geneva 1954 - End of Resistance Against France
historicalEvents.description: After winning Dien Bien Phu, one of the major turning points in history Vietnam, the Geneva talks took place from April 26 to July 21, 1954. The victory created favorable conditions for the negotiating parties to end the war, while setting a turning point in dividing Vietnam into the North and the South. At the Geneva Conference, the Government Vietnam the Democratic Republic under the leadership of the Chairman Ho Chi Minh won an important victory, leading to the signing of the Geneva Agreement, in which France had to withdraw its troops from Indochina, while ending the brutal war that lasted for nearly 9 years. However, the victory Dien Bien Phu also marked the beginning of a new period of struggle when the country was divided into two regions. Although the Geneva Agreement does not bring complete unity to the country, it is an important step in ending the war with France, bringing the people Vietnam a period of peace, helping Dai Viet settle down after years of fierce war.

historicalEvents.title: The contribution of Dien Bien Phu to the construction of the People's Army Vietnam
historicalEvents.description: Winning Dien Bien Phu is not only a great military victory, but it is also meaningful in building and developing the People's Army Vietnam. This battle proved that the People's Army Vietnam could confront colonial powers while affirming the strength of the People's War and the wise leadership of the Communist Party Vietnam. Dien Bien Phu has changed the course of war and is a clear demonstration of the military and people's combined strength. This victory is also a great source of encouragement for generations of officers and soldiers, a valuable lesson in perseverance, solidarity and creativity in combat. In addition, Dien Bien Phu is a symbol of the strong development of the military force, opening a new era for the military Vietnam, where the military is not only good at tactics but also has the ability to flexibly improvise in real situations. Dien Bien Phu is an important milestone in the construction and development of the People's Army Vietnam, laying the foundation for future victories in the war against the U.S.

historicalEvents.title: Dien Bien Phu in culture and history Vietnam
historicalEvents.description: Winning Dien Bien Phu is not only a military feat but also a cultural icon, an endless source of inspiration in literature, art and national spirit. Dien Bien Phu has entered literary, musical, cinematic works, expressing Vietnam's patriotism, sacrifice and determined fighting spirit. Works such as 'Dien Bien Phu' by writer Nguyen Huu Quy, or songs such as 'Going to Dien Bien' clearly depict soldiers and people Vietnam in the struggle for independence. In addition, the victory Dien Bien Phu shows the nation's strength in protecting independence, freedom, and an unforgettable mark in Vietnam history, bringing pride and continuing to be passed on to future generations. Dien Bien Phu is also an integral part of education programs, widely taught in schools, reminding younger generations of patriotic traditions, unity and invaluable lessons in the struggle for national independence. Not only is it a military victory, Dien Bien Phu is also a testament to the unity, strong will, and the desire of the nation Vietnam for freedom.
